We need you to bring creative ideas and diverse backgrounds to help us envision, shape, and deliver systems that will enable the exploration of space while benefiting people here on Earth. We are excited about what we do, and we need you on our team as we take on exciting challenges for NASA’s pursuits in deep space exploration. Jacobs is NASA’s largest engineering solutions provider working together with NASA at centers across the United States.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We have an exciting opportunity for a <b>Spring 2023 - Geochemistry Intern<\u002Fb><b> <\u002Fb>within our Science &amp; Exploration Division.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i>This is a temporary role not to exceed 3 months.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p>The Spring 2023 - Geochemistry Intern will:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>The proposed intern project is a part of a study funded by the Solar System Working program entitled “Assessment of phyllosilicate survivability\u002Falteration in complex acidic environments on Mars”. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>The main objective of this research is to assess the alteration mechanisms of Mars analog clays in complex low-pH solutions, which could exist on ancient Mars. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>This study uses laboratory and field settings to determine mineralogical, structural, and compositional changes in clays exposed to Mars analog acid rock drainage environments.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform other duties as required.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> Requisition Qualifications: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Currently enrolled at an accredited university.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Completed at least 60 credit hours.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum of a 2.8 GPA.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Geology\u002Fgeoscience students <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Requisition Preferences:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Graduates with lab experience and geochemistry coursework<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Why Join Our Team?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Click on the below links to view just a small sample of all that we do! <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Our core Life Sciences network has become the largest provider of engineering and construction services to pharmaceutical and biotechnology clients in the world. Jacobs provides full-service engineering, procurement, and construction management services to both new and existing facilities. For projects of every scale, we provide design, engineering, construction, commissioning, and maintenance services that support a facility's entire life cycle.<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <p>This position is for a process (chemical) engineering intern\u002F co-op in either our San Francisco or Irvine offices.<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Intern will work with process engineers in assisting them executing projects for our various clients.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work could be in the pharmaceutical, biotech, or chemical industries. Some tasks may include elementary process calculations, CADDing of drawings, maintaining equipment\u002Fline lists, creating flow diagrams, and coordinating with other disciplines.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Interns may have an opportunity to visit an on-going project site to engage in construction activities and provide field support.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Typical salary range for this position is $24.00 - $29.00\u002Fhr and is commensurate with experience relative to the position. For “remote” positions, salary to be offered is geographic dependent.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Engineering student working towards a BS or MS in Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Biochemical Engineering at a 4 year accredited university is required. 3rd year student or higher preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prior internship experience, especially in the pharmaceutical industry, is desirable, but not required.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum GPA of 3.0 is preferred.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), age, medical condition, marital or domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression and transgender status, mental disability or physical disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, citizenship, low-income status or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable law. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we’re not just building structures, we’re helping our clients innovate and grow by designing, engineering, and executing the construction of their state-of-the-art facilities that are changing our world.<\u002Fp> \n <p>This position is responsible for procurement transactions associated with subcontracting of services. The incumbent has working knowledge and understanding of procurement concepts, principles and practices, and the techniques of ensuring task completion. The incumbent understands the role of procurement and its integration with other project functions, accomplishes value-added expectations, and performs assignments in accordance with established policies and procedures.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Job Duties and Responsibilities:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Subcontracting assignments typically will consist of professional or technical services, and major construction services, or may be assigned as the lead for all subcontracting on a small project.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Utilize established policies, procedures, systems, and tools<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Advises to stakeholders how to create requisitions and helps them in understanding the overall Procurement process<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Administers Procurement Agreements and change orders (modifications).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Reviews invoices related with subcontracts and ensures that invoices are approved in accordance with terms and conditions agreed within the agreement<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Evaluates facts surrounding purchase subcontract-related problem areas and applies remedies to resolve it<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintains subcontracting documentation in a repository<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Identify and advise management of subcontract-related risks.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepare bidder lists, qualify bidders, prepare requests for quotation\u002Fproposal, and conduct bid evaluations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Recommend source selections, lead purchase order negotiations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure applicable prime contract flow-downs are identified, addressed, and included in assigned subcontracts<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist in the preparation of proposal deliverables, including pricing of subcontracted services, execution approach narratives, and labor hour estimates for subcontracting.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Works under moderate to minimal supervision. No direct reports. Supervises the work of procurement support personnel who assist with the purchasing activities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinates with project or departmental personnel in performance of the subcontracting activities.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Typical salary range for this position is $64,000 to $112,000, and is commensurate with experience relative to the position.<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<br> <\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelors Degree<\u002Fli> \n  <li>At least 2 years applicable experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>United States Citizenship<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. <p>Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i> We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. That's why we bring a thoughtful and collaborative approach to every one of our partnerships.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> At Jacobs, we challenge the status quo and redefine how to solve the world's greatest challenges, transforming big ideas into intelligent solutions for a more connected, sustainable world.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <b> Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> This is a IBEW union position supporting first shift. You are reporting to only one location, NASA Langley Research Center. <\u002Fb>The Electrician will support the Maintenance Services group by testing the availability of utilities, preventive maintenance and overall support to the electrical systems team and electrical distribution system.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Responsibilities:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Performs a variety of electrical trade functions such as the installation, maintenance, or repair of equipment for the generation, distribution, or utilization of electric energy<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Installation or repair of a variety of electrical equipment such as generators, transformers, switchboards, controllers, circuit breakers, fire alarm systems, motors, heating units, conduit systems or other transmission equipment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working from blueprints, drawings, layouts, or other specifications; locating and diagnosing trouble in the electrical system or equipment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working standard computations relating to load requirements of wiring or electrical equipment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Use a variety of electrician’s hand tools, measuring and testing<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work will include additional duties as assigned<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> U.S. Citizenship required.<b> <\u002Fb>Eight years of experience or any equivalent combination of experience and training in a designated field, craft or trade that can be documented by a certificate or diploma from a reputable organization, school, or trade school program. Must be Virginia state licensed, journeyman level worker. Must be able to effectively communicate with others.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Essential Functions<\u002Fp> \n <p>Work Environment:<br> Test Environment (85%) - May be exposed to areas of high noise levels, hazardous propellants, chemicals, and industrial facilities. Travel between various facilities and during test operations is required. May bring exposure to loud noise and potentially hazardous equipment operations. (15%)<\u002Fp> \n <p>Physical Requirements:<br> Visual and physical (hands on) contact of test related systems, hardware, and articles. Must be able to walk, stand, bend, twist and sit for extended periods as well as climb, crawl, and lift-up to 35 lbs. (100%). Ability to distinguish basic colors (10%). Corrected vision and hearing at all times (100%) Must be able to use the following: Platform or A-frame ladders up to 12 Ft (30%) Extension ladders up to 24 Ft (10%) Personal or one man aerial lifts up to 30 Ft. (10%) Articulating or boom aerial lifts up to 35 Ft. (10%)<br> <br> Equipment and Machines:<br> Will use hand tools, power tools, mechanical, and electrical control devices (40%)<\u002Fp> \n <p>Control room test operation display\u002Fkeyboards, mechanical and electrical control devices (20%) Personal computers and related equipment (10%)<\u002Fp> \n <p>Safety and personal protective equipment (50%)<\u002Fp> \n <p>Attendance:<br> Regular attendance is mandatory (100%)<br> Overtime\u002Fwork outside normal schedule required (&lt;20%)<br> <br> Other Essential Functions:<br> U.S. Citizenship required. Valid driver's license is required. Must be able to work in a team atmosphere. Must put forward a professional behavior that enhances productivity and promotes teamwork and cooperation. Grooming and dress must be appropriate for the position and not impose a safety\u002Frisk hazard to the employee or others. CMOE Maintenance employees will exercise diligence when developing a Safe Plan of Action (SPA) for each task performed. Your SPA is a Company provided resource to be used for the prevention of incidents, accidents, and injuries: as such, it is the most important resource you are required to use. Must be able to obtain and maintain a security clearance as required.<\u002Fp> Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. May be assigned to assist in the spill response team May be required to obtain and maintain asbestos certification for the purpose of removing asbestos.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs other related duties as assigned.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>May perform work in other classifications when incidental work is necessary to the accomplishment of the work assignment. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we challenge what is currently accepted, so we can shape innovative and lasting solutions for tomorrow. If you’re interested in a rewarding career working with the industry’s best and most innovative engineers, then Jacobs is where you belong. Join a company invested in you, your success and the global community, join us as a the Land Survey Crew Leader in Litlle Rock, AR.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We are looking for a dedicated Land Survey Crew Leader to grow with our collaborative team and work on a variety of projects. Under the direction of the Professional Surveyor, you will be responsible for the supervision and training of the survey crew in conducting all phases of surveys including Control Surveys to perform EDM, Elevation Control – Three Wire Level, Photogrammetric Mapping Targets, and Levels, Design Surveys to perform Topography and Terrain Data Collection, and Land Surveys to perform Parcel Surveys, Right-of-Way Staking, Right-of-Way Monument and Final Plat.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Here's what you'll do:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Supervise and conduct, depending on the specialty (location, land, or geodetic) roadway, bridge, parcel, photogrammetric, and geodetic control surveys.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Use computer for data processing, coordinate geometry computations, and computer-aided design and drafting (CADD).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Obtain hydraulic information.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Locate and reference existing land and property corners.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Stake and monument highway rights of way.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Train, mentor, provide technical assistance to and maintain a survey crew.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepare and maintain daily work, expense, vehicle and equipment reports.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Operate computer, electronic data collector, and computer-aided drafting and design (CADD) workstation<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in surveying or related field, OR the educational equivalent to a diploma from an accredited high school and four years of directly related experience. Experience conducting surveys for highway locations, bridge, land, and control surveys.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Extensive knowledge of survey principles and practices<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficiency in computations for highway route locations and parcel surveys.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Extensive knowledge of the functions of a survey crew<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficiency in the use, care and operation of high-tech survey equipment, calculators, automated data collection system, coordinate geometry computations, and CADD.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficiency in reading, understanding, and plotting land descriptions. Mathematical skills through trigonometry.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Valid driver’s license<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Physical requirements:<\u002Fb><br> Physical ability to work with hand tools. Ability to traverse over rugged terrain, through water and work in an outdoor environment. Ability to stand and operate surveying equipment for at least two hours at a time. Ability to carry 50 pounds of equipment and supplies with or without reasonable accommodation.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Working conditions:<\u002Fb><br> Ability to perform assigned duties in all types of weather as well as other work conditions, e.g. noise, dust, fumes, etc. Constant statewide travel.<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), age, medical condition, marital or domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression and transgender status, mental disability or physical disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, citizenship, low-income status or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable law. Learn more about your rights under Federal EEO laws and supplemental language.\n <p><i><br> At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private Responsibilities also include use of AIS such as GCSS-MC\u002FSSAVIE and material handling equipment. The incumbent shall be able to obtain an operators’ license for non-tactical and tactical Government-owned equipment.<br> <br> Minimum Education\u002FExperience Requirements: High School or GED equivalent and Four (4) years of relevant, progressive experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.<br> <br> Must possess an active Secret Security Clearance.<br> <br> Essential Functions<br> Work will be performed inside a warehouse facility. Work assignments vary based on client requirements. Standard core working hours are 8 AM to 4;30 PM Monday through Friday, but depending upon operational demands, the position could require some night and weekend work. Some travel may be required based on client requirements.<br> Physical Requirements<br> Work may involve sitting or standing for extended periods of time. Phone use and PC or laptop. Filing required. May require lifting and carrying boxes of supplies or files up to 50 lbs. Must have sufficient mobility, included but not limited to: bending, reaching, turning and kneeling to complete daily duties in a timely and efficient manner.<br> Equipment and Machines<br> Operation of non-tactical and\u002For tactical Government-owned equipment, to include gas\u002Fdiesel and\u002For electric forklifts, and wheeled vehicles, use of pallet jacks, and other such material handling equipment (MHE). General office equipment, which includes: telephone, fax machine, copier, PC\u002Flaptop, and other work related tools as required.<br> Attendance<br> Work assignments dependent on requirements by the client. It is important to be able to work at least 8 hours a day for 5 days per week (Monday through Friday). Must exhibit flexibility of work hours to adjust to surge situations based on critical mission requirements.<br> Other Essential Functions<br> Candidate must exhibit a professional behavior that promotes teamwork, fosters cooperation, and enhances productivity in the workplace. Must be well organized with the ability to coordinate, prioritize and execute multiple tasks simultaneously in a high-pressure environment. Ability to communicate verbally and in writing to work effectively with a variety of government, military and contractor personnel at all levels. Must be able to interface effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization. Grooming and dress usually business casual, but dependent on client’s standards. Must not pose a safety hazard to employees working in the same general area.<br> The position for which you are applying for requires a US government security clearance. We are looking for a driven and curious <b>Planner \u002F Scheduler<\u002Fb> in (Oakland CA), to support our Program Management Team.<br> As a key member of our program support team, you’ll be interacting with engineering and construction to understand and communicate issues and conflicts that impact the schedule. You will also analyze CPM schedules and recommend work-arounds and schedule improvements.<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Join us and we will assist you in continuing the development of your skills and exploring all that you can do across our global company, with opportunities to share your knowledge along the way.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Bachelor’s degree<\u002Fli> \n  <li>2+ years of Planning \u002F Scheduling experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A good understanding of building construction, timelines, and practices<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience Working inside the Primavera (P6) scheduling tool<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Ideally, here’s what you’ll also have:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Experience with EVM (Earned Value Management)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to develop cost \u002F schedule analysis presentations both graphically, written, and verbally.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent communication skills and understanding of technical terminology<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Jacobs health and welfare benefits are designed to invest in you, and in the things you care about. Some travel may be required based on client requirements.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Physical Requirements<br> Work may involve sitting or standing for extended periods of time. Phone use and PC or laptop. Filing required. May require lifting and carrying boxes of supplies or files up to 50 lbs. It is important to be able to work at least 8 hours a day for 5 days per week (Monday through Friday). Must exhibit flexibility of work hours to adjust to surge situations based on critical mission requirements.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Other Essential Functions<br> Candidate must exhibit a professional behavior that promotes teamwork, fosters cooperation, and enhances productivity in the workplace. Must be well organized with the ability to coordinate, prioritize and execute multiple tasks simultaneously in a high-pressure environment. Ability to communicate verbally and in writing to work effectively with a variety of government, military and contractor personnel at all levels. Must be able to interface effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization. Grooming and dress usually business casual, but dependent on client’s standards. Must not pose a safety hazard to employees working in the same general area.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> The position for which you are applying for requires a US government security clearance. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> As a Junior Security Technologist, assigned to our Portland, Oregon office but working remotely from Oregon, Washington, Idaho or Northern California if desired, you will work under the guidance of project managers and our other security technology leads. You will have the opportunity to assist in the planning and producing security designs for buildings, facilities, and sites. This involves working with our security teams to produce security schematics and schedules; to develop security plan drawings; to produce calculations for video storage, bandwidth consumption and power loads; to provide input in cross-discipline coordination efforts; and to aid in the identification of conflicts or inconsistencies with architectural, civil, electrical and instrumentation groups.<\u002Fp> \n <p>In this role as a Junior Security Technologist, it is not expected that you will have extensive experience in security technology or that you have an established professional network of industry contacts. However, we do require a willingness to learn, an ability to dedicate yourself to growth in a rapidly evolving technology field, and a commitment to join a strong team and help with a wide variety of tasks. Our experienced team will work with you to teach you the fundamentals of physical and electronic security, building your knowledge of video surveillance, card access systems, biometric controls and physical intrusion detection technologies.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Jacobs health and welfare benefits are designed to invest in you, and in the things you care about. Your health. Your well-being. Your security. Your future. Typical benefits offered include flexible work schedules and opportunities to work remotely, educational reimbursement, retirement benefits, employee stock purchase plan, health benefits, disability benefits, life and accident insurance, voluntary benefits, paid time off and paid holidays, and parental leave.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Typical salary range for this position is $58,000 to $90,000 and is commensurate with experience relative to the position. For “remote” positions, salary to be offered is geographic dependent.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>BS graduate of electrical engineering, computer science or related technical field or scientific discipline.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficiency in MS 365 suite of applications; Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Excellent communications skills.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Keen attention to detail.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Ideally, you'll also have:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Understanding of physical security topics; video surveillance, card access, biometric systems, physical intrusion detection.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficiency in reading engineering plans and schematic drawings.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Basic understanding of network technology, cyber security topics.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Basic understanding of various tradeoffs between wireless, fiber optic and copper cabling communications technology.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience using Bluebeam editing tools and design collaboration software.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with Revit, BIM360, AutoCAD or MicroStation software.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we challenge what is currently accepted, so we can shape innovative and lasting solutions for tomorrow. If you’re interested in a rewarding career working with the industry’s best and most innovative engineers, then Jacobs is where you belong. We are looking for a passionate and curious client-focused Procurement Professional to grow with our team.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As a Procurement Professional, you’ll provide Supply Management services to make sure that the Program’s goods and services; including purchasing and subcontracting, meet project schedules and expectations.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We’ll rely on you to perform all subcontract formation duties for assigned subcontracts, including prequalification of bidders, solicitation of proposals, proposal evaluations, source selection recommendations as well as lead negotiation of contract terms and pricing issues, conformance and finalizing of agreements, and subcontract issuance and implementation. You’ll ensure applicable prime contract flow-downs are identified, addressed, and included in assigned subcontracts and obtain necessary reviews and approvals of bidder exceptions, bid evaluations, source selection recommendations, Subcontracts, and change orders prior to execution.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We’ll have you ensure budget compliance issues are addressed and award subcontracts, perform subcontract post-award administration duties, including change order management, contractual compliance, invoice verification, performance evaluation, closeout of agreements, and records retention.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Our “Future of Work” approach will offer you the opportunity to spend time working both in the office and time working from home. We want you to be empowered to deliver the boldest solutions for everyday living so explore us! Your role keeps our company connected and we’ll support you with what you need to be successful.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs health and welfare benefits are designed to invest in you, and in the things you care about. Your health. Your well-being. Your security. Your future. Typical benefits offered include flexible work schedules and opportunities to work remotely, educational reimbursement, retirement benefits, employee stock purchase plan, health benefits, disability benefits, life and accident insurance, voluntary benefits, paid time off and paid holidays, and parental leave.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Typical salary range for this position is $75,800 to $118,500 and is commensurate with experience relative to the position. For “remote” positions, salary to be offered is geographic dependent.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Overall Knowledge of Jacobs\u002FIndustry Business: Understands major technical, organizational, managerial and business issues related to procurement management. Extensive knowledge of commercial procurement laws and standards as they relate to Jacobs operations management and project delivery. Thorough understanding of Construction subcontracting. Understands and is committed to Jacobs’ Core Values.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Project Delivery Knowledge: Understands project delivery processes (i.e., purchasing and subcontracting) and their relationship to supply management delivery.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Communications: Has excellent communications and writing skills. Is able to effectively author contractual commitment documents, as well as internal and external communications. Must be able to effectively communicate with clients and interact with operations, project, and construction managers.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Systems: Uses computer in support of supply management including Supply Management software, electronic mail, and standard desktop software.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Bachelors degree or 4 years of additional experience in lieu of degree<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience in supply management or related fields in the EPCM industry<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Previous Water experience highly preferred<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. Work performed varies from trade to trade. <\u002Fp>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Essential Duties &amp; Job Functions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Assists one or more workers in the skilled maintenance trades by performing specific or general duties of lesser skill, such as keeping a worker supplied with materials and tools; cleaning working area, machine, and equipment; assisting journeyman by holding materials or tools; and performing other unskilled tasks as directed by journeyman.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>The kind of work the helper is permitted to perform varies from trade to trade. In some trades the helper is confined to supplying, lifting, and holding materials and tools, performing fire watch duties, and cleaning work areas; and in others the helper is permitted to perform specialized machine operations, or parts of a trade that are also performed by workers on a full‑time basis.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs other related duties as assigned.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>May perform work in other classifications when incidental work is necessary to the accomplishment of the work assignment. Significant work in another job classification may be required if accompanied by any wage adjustments applicable.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Accountable For:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>The proper use of tools and equipment commonly used in the relevant trade field. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Completing all mandated training requirements per government and management directives.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Timely and cost-effective performance of duties.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Timely completion and accuracy of all departmental work.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Dealing with a variety of people in a professional, courteous manner in diversified situations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Adherence to established company safety policies and good industrial and office safety practices. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Compliance with company Standard Operating Procedures and Personnel policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Having the ability to work well under pressure.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Requirements (Education, Experience, Professional Associations):<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Mandatory<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>One-year experience or equivalent in one of the general trade areas including the placement of insulation materials. Vocational training may be substituted for experience.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must have knowledge of tools and equipment used in the trade.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be able to follow blueprint, diagram, or other types of written or verbal instructions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must obtain and maintain required explosives certifications when assigned to ordnance operations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must have and maintain hand tools of the trade to perform the normal work of the classifications.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must possess a valid Washington State driver's license.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must meet and maintain company physical and security requirements, including respirator qualification, and clearance eligibility when required. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> We share a common purpose – to make the world more connected and sustainable. And we’re excited about the innovative ways we can change the world. If you are also interested in turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good, then Jacobs is where you belong. We are looking for a passionate and dedicated HSE Manager to support our team in Destin, FL.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As the HSE Manager, you will be responsible for coordination and implementation of the JV Health Safety and Environmental (HSE) Program. In this role, you also will provide administrative liaison and coordination with Jacobs HSE and Risk Management on matters pertaining to the HSE Program. If you’re up for the challenge, we’ve been looking for someone just like you.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Additional Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Monitor the project safety management process with regards to effective implementation of loss prevention activities and contractor adherence to contractual safety requirements.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Investigate any incidents involving injury, property loss or near-misses. Communicate with Jacobs and JV leadership and program staff regarding these matters, assist in identifying root causes and lessons learned, and oversee the implementation of corrective action plans as appropriate.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinate with program staff to ensure that adequate safety resources and PPE are available and used properly to support project safety.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist program staff in monitoring such measures as employee badging, access control, and school perimeter security.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Monitor contractors’ safety measures including their documentation related to workforce on site and records of contractor safety training and incidents reports.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Track safety performance metrics on a monthly basis and document site activities, incident information, and safety metrics to support JV monthly reports as needed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Attend the Contractors’ preconstruction kick-off meetings to discuss overall safety requirements of the Contractor as it relates to JV’s safety program.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Be available to program staff on an on-call basis to provide technical assistance and consultation related to observed contractor safety issues.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Walk the active construction projects on a regular basis with the respective program and contractor staff to observe safety measures, conditions &amp; practices and make recommendations as appropriate to improve safety.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure that an overall written JV Program Safety Plan is developed and maintained and includes any site-specific measures for each project.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Look for opportunities to enhance safety training in hazard recognition, PPE, etc. Arrange for formal safety training for program staff as needed.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Actively support and coach the program and contractor staffs in the use of Safety Observation Reports (SOR) and Safe Plans of Action (SPA) and periodically audit their effectiveness.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Professional HSE certification<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Minimum 5 years of demonstrated professional experience in a similar leadership role in managing Construction Health and Safety<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated experience as change agent, influencing construction\u002FHSE behaviors for the better<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated and successful experience in making objective and positive improvements in safety<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong interpersonal and communications skills to engage with multiple stakeholders including owner, contractors, A\u002FE’s, JV staff, etc.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Ideally, You’ll Have:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Bachelor’s degree in safety, industrial hygiene, engineering or related field<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. <p>Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i> We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. That's why we bring a thoughtful and collaborative approach to every one of our partnerships.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> At Jacobs, we challenge the status quo and redefine how to solve the world's greatest challenges, transforming big ideas into intelligent solutions for a more connected, sustainable world.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <b> Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Wages –$33.28 per hour<\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Summary\u002FGeneral Description of Job:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p>The General Maintenance Worker repairs building structures and mechanical, electrical and sanitary systems. The incumbent also performs general maintenance on machinery.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Essential Duties &amp; Job Functions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Performs general maintenance and repair of building structures and their mechanical, electrical, or sanitary systems.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>May also perform general maintenance and repair of the establishment's machinery.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintains basic practical knowledge of several maintenance trades in order to perform most of the duties.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Keeps in good repair building woodwork, wall, floor and other surface treatments.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Replaces electrical switches, fixtures, and motors.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>May painting or touching up of structure or equipment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Repairs or replaces plumbing fixtures, household appliances and equipment; and replacing broken window panes. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Performs other related duties as assigned.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>May perform work in other classifications when incidental work is necessary to the accomplishment of the work assignment. Significant work in another job classification may be required if accompanied by any wage adjustments applicable.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Accountable For:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>The proper use of tools and equipment commonly used in the maintenance field. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Completing all mandated training requirements per government and management directives.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Timely and cost-effective performance of duties.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Timely completion and accuracy of all departmental work.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Dealing with a variety of people in a professional, courteous manner in diversified situations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Adherence to established company safety policies and good industrial and office safety practices. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Compliance with company Standard Operating Procedures and Personnel policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Having the ability to work well under pressure.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Requirements (Education, Experience, Professional Associations):<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Mandatory<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Four years’ experience maintaining in a state of good repair buildings, and associated equipment of housing units, office buildings, recreational buildings, or institutional buildings.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be able to interpret blueprints, drawings, etc.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be familiar with a wide variety of test equipment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be familiar with repair and modification of plumbing, electrical, sewage, heating, air conditioning systems, and household appliances.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must obtain and maintain required explosives certifications when assigned to ordnance operations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must have and maintain hand tools of the trade to perform the normal work of the classifications.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must possess a valid State driver's license with acceptable driving record.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must meet and maintain company physical and security requirements, including respirator qualification, and clearance eligibility when required. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Must possess good communication skills for a service team environment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>May be required to pass a “backflow preventer” certification when required by the assignment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be able to lift 50 pounds.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to successfully pass any background checks and\u002For drug testing required on the contract.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>U.S. Citizenship.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Candidates for <p>Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i> We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. That's why we bring a thoughtful and collaborative approach to every one of our partnerships.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> At Jacobs, we challenge the status quo and redefine how to solve the world's greatest challenges, transforming big ideas into intelligent solutions for a more connected, sustainable world.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <b> Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> A. FUNCTION OF POSITION<br> A STAR labs engineering technician will support the machining and assembly of material test models and other components.The technician will also support model and instrumentation fabrication and assembly.<br> B. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES<br> 1. Use basic powered and manual shop equipment such as band saw, disc sander, drill press, manual lathe, and manual mill.<br> 2. Setup and operation of CNC mills and lathes.<br> 3. Interpret engineering drawings, cut rough stock, independently design and machine fixtures to machine hardware, and set up tooling.<br> 4. Excellent communication skills and ability to work well in small teams is a must.<br> 5. Able to juggle multiple projects often sidelining some projects to expedite others.<br> 6. Overtime may be required.<br> 7. Support instrumentation and model assembly.<br> C. NATURE OF POSITION CHALLENGES<br> The employee may be juggling multiple projects at a time with varying deadlines. There may be cases where a project must be sidelined for a more urgent project. Some projects may be cancelled mid work. The employee may be required to communicate with requestors (customers) to clarify the requirements of the work. Occasionally requestor will want to be present when the hardware is being machined or fabricated. The employee should be comfortable with imperial and metric units. There may be cases imperial and metric units will be used on the same design.<br> D. SUPERVISOR GUIDANCE<br> General guidance shall be provided by the STAR Labs Supervisor. The employee will report to a lead senior machinist for direct guidance.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> <b>Unusual or Special Physical Requirements of Position<\u002Fb><br> Visual and physical contact with test system hardware and installed test articles. Multiple workstation assignments (office, test facility, control room, laboratory, shops, etc.). Transportation of notebooks, clothing\u002Fequipment drawings, forms, sensors, etc. required. Ability to hear normal (wearing) conversation. One eye (minimum) correctable to 20\u002F20. Ability to distinguish eight colors on basic panel displays and wiring. Ability to manipulate small and delicate instruments and wiring.<br> <br> <b>Description of Work Environment<\u002Fb><br> Work is accomplished in the STAR Labs shops and offices. Movement is required between these work areas as well as trips to the client or user's facility. Must be able to use respiratory temperatures involved protection. Some work areas are high in noise.<br> <br> <b>Equipment and Machines Involved in Work Tasks<\u002Fb><br> Hand and power tools; computers; calculators; CNC mills and electronically\u002Fbattery operated lathes; ladders.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Criticality of Attendance<\u002Fb><br> Work assignments are usually during normal work hours (~0630 - days ~1600). 40hrs\u002Fwk. A regular attendance schedule is required. The lab works a compressed schedule where every other Friday is an off day. The other Friday will conclude at 1500.<br> <br> <b>Other Essential Functions<\u002Fb><br> Must be able to obtain a NASA badge and gain access to the work facilities.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <div>\n  <br> Preferred experience of a minimum of 5 years.\n  <br> AS degree preferred, but not required.\n  <br> Preferred, but no required, experience with the following:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>SurfCAM<\u002Fli>\n   <li>HAAS mills, lathes, and the Mini Mill<\u002Fli>\n   <li>SoildWorks (basic familiarity such as being able to open drawings, evaluate solid models, and make minor edits)<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <p>Experience with basic powered and manual shop equipment such as band saw, disc sander, drill press, manual lathe, and manual mill.<\u002Fp> Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. You’ll also provide on-site assistance during startup, coordinate work activities with other staff members and the discipline lead. <p>Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i> We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. Learn basic to advanced computing concepts with a team that strives to advance their knowledge and research new and better ways to improve.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Individual will join the EPG Service Desk to provide end user desktop support to on-site and remote personnel. Technician will provide tier I to tier II troubleshooting skills to diagnose and resolve user requests through an internal ticketing system and by phone. Basic to intermediate Windows 10 administration knowledge to include Active Directory Users and Computers, DHCP, Microsoft Management Console, Remote Support applications and others. Proficient troubleshooting skills for Microsoft Office Suite. Software and hardware troubleshooting skills. Basic knowledge of networking concepts to assist other teams with physical and logical connectivity issues. Applicant will provide Video Teleconferencing Support to setup meetings and standby support to promptly resolve technical issues that arise during a call. This opportunity provides an excellent setting to develop IT skills and learn from a wide range of skill sets while collaborating with experienced IT professionals.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> Required Education, Training, and Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>HS Diploma and 5 yrs exp or any equivalent combination of relevant education and experience.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Maintain a Security + CE (or equivalent IAT II).<\u002Fp> \n <p>Excellent customer service skills with the ability to empathize and professionally troubleshoot customer issues.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Current\u002Fvalid driver's license. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Must be able to maintain a Secret Security Clearance.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p><b>Job <\u002Fb><b>Description: <\u002Fb>Jacobs Technology is seeking Entry Level Service Desk Technician to support the Electronic Proving Ground (EPG) contract in Fort Huachuca, AZ. <\u002Fp>\n     <p>Join an exceptional learning environment that encourages everyone to share and improve their IT skillset. Technician will provide tier I to tier II troubleshooting skills to diagnose and resolve user requests through an internal ticketing system and by phone. Basic to intermediate Windows 10 administration knowledge to include Active Directory Users and Computers, DHCP, Microsoft Management Console, Remote Support applications and others. Proficient troubleshooting skills for Microsoft Office Suite. Software and hardware troubleshooting skills. Basic knowledge of networking concepts to assist other teams with physical and logical connectivity issues. Applicant will provide Video Teleconferencing Support to setup meetings and standby support to promptly resolve technical issues that arise during a call. This opportunity provides an excellent setting to develop IT skills and learn from a wide range of skill sets while collaborating with experienced IT professionals.<\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p><b>Essential Functions for Position<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p><b>Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p>Work may involve sitting or standing for extended periods of time. Position may require filing, typing, and reading from a computer screen. Must have sufficient mobility, included but not limited to: bending, reaching, turning and kneeling to complete daily duties in a timely and efficient manner. There is a possibility that due to parking availability and location of work, walking moderate to long distances may be required.<\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p><b>Work Environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     Generally, an office environment, but can involve inside or outside work depending on task. An inside environment may be a cubicle (considerations: close quarters, low to moderate noise, bright or dim lighting). Needs to be able to work well with co-workers, customer, and all levels of management. No hazards on job or unusual environmental conditions. Work site is located at Ft. Huachuca, AZ.\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <br> \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p><b>Equipment and Machines<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     Ability to operate office equipment such as a personal computer, printer, copy machine, telephone, fax machine and other equipment including desk supplies and other work-related tools as required.\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <br> \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p><b>Attendance<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     Regular hours will be between Monday – Friday 7:00am – 4:00pm. This is a 9\u002F80 work schedule allowing for every other Friday off. Regular attendance of scheduled hours is important. Punctuality and regular attendance are necessary to meet deadlines. Must exhibit flexibility of work hours to adjust to surge situations based on critical mission requirements.\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <br> \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p><b>Other Essential Functions<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p>Candidate must have excellent written and oral communications skills. Must have clear, concise, and accurate communications skills in English, both verbal and written. Grooming and dress must be appropriate for the position and must not impose a safety risk to employees or others. Must maintain a positive work atmosphere by behaving and communicating in a professional manner. Independent personal transportation to office or work site is required. Travel to and from customer’s locations and the test fields may be required to support projects. This may involve airline travel. In some cases, accommodations can possibly be made for POV, if necessary. Provides organizational integrity for the group, and effectively utilizes the manpower available for peak productivity. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we challenge what is currently accepted, so we can shape innovative and lasting solutions for tomorrow. If you’re interested in a rewarding career working with the industry’s best and most innovative engineers, then Jacobs is where you belong. Join a company invested in you, your success and the global community, join Jacobs as a the Land Survey Field Technician Aide in Litlle Rock, AR.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We are looking for a dedicated Land Survey Field Technician Aide to grow with our collaborative team and work on a variety of projects. Under general supervision, you will be responsible for measuring distances and traversing across various terrains to gather accurate information detailing land characteristics. In this role, you will analyze, compilate, and archive survey control, topographic and terrain data using the Department’s computer software.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Here's what you'll do:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Clean and care of survey equipment \u002F Clean and service survey vehicles.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Use hand tools such as sledge, axe, chainsaw, kaiser blade, shovel, etc.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Clear brush for view; climb trees to trim limbs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Set up safety equipment and flag traffic when necessary.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Use survey instruments, calculators, automated electronic data collectors, and GPS equipment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Train in reading and plotting land descriptions and the use of computers.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform field reconnaissance for Public Land Survey System (PLSS) monuments.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Operate current generation of computers, electronic data collector, and computer-aided design and drafting (CADD).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Produce maps that conform to national accuracy standards.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Compile survey field, photogrammetric, and LiDAR point cloud data into a combined topographic and<\u002Fli> \n  <li>digital terrain model (DTM) for Department design divisions.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>High School Diploma or equivalent<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Computer knowledge<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Valid driver’s license<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Ideally, You’ll Also Have:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Previous experience with control, engineering design, or land surveying<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Physical requirements:<\u002Fb><br> Physical ability to work with hand tools. Ability to traverse over rugged terrain, through water and work in an outdoor environment. Ability to stand and operate surveying equipment for at least two hours at a time. Ability to carry 50 pounds of equipment and supplies with or without reasonable accommodation.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Working conditions:<\u002Fb><br> Ability to perform assigned duties in all types of weather as well as other work conditions, e.g. noise, dust, fumes, etc. Constant statewide travel.<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), age, medical condition, marital or domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression and transgender status, mental disability or physical disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, citizenship, low-income status or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable law. Learn more about your rights under Federal EEO laws and supplemental language.\n <p><i><br> At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> We’re seeking an Electrical Designer to join our Greenville, SC team of professionals. The best part is you can live anywhere within the U.S., ideally in the South East Region to support our team successfully. You'll support preparation of electrical design packages as you work alongside our team of engineers and designers to develop drawings and schedules, support estimating efforts, perform field investigations, interface with clients &amp; vendors, and prepare construction design packages. You’ll be a key member of our team in electrical design for various types of clients including industrial, chemical, pulp &amp; paper, general manufacturing, Data Centers, Electric Vehicles and pharmaceutical facilities. We’ll tap into your expertise as you develop the design documents for the packages. Candidate will have hands on experience with 3D design software platforms for electrical equipment and systems, and the understanding of various construction deliverables that will bring value to clients.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Your most impactful mission in this role is to act as a champion for our TogetherBeyond culture of caring at Jacobs. TogetherBeyond is our approach to living inclusion every day and enabling diversity and quality globally. For us, this means creating a culture of belonging where we all thrive by embracing all perspectives.<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Bring your curiosity, passion for innovation, and expertise. We’ll help you grow, pursue, and fulfill what inspires you – so we can make big impacts on the world, together.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Minimum of 8 years' of professional experience in the design of Electrical systems.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Thorough knowledge of codes and standards related to design of Electrical systems.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Ideally, You’ll Also Have:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>10 plus years' of professional experience in the design of Electrical systems.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Proficiency in Revit, SmartPlant 3D, SmartPlant Electrical.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Familiarity within EV and Datacenter markets'.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Significant field experience and familiarity with electrical systems.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. <p>Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i> We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. That's why we bring a thoughtful and collaborative approach to every one of our partnerships.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> At Jacobs, we challenge the status quo and redefine how to solve the world's greatest challenges, transforming big ideas into intelligent solutions for a more connected, sustainable world.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <b> Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <p> Jacobs Technology Group is a performance unit of the Jacobs Critical Mission Solutions (CMS) Line of Business. The Jacobs CMS Technology Group specializes in the design, construction, and operation of unique and complex research and development facilities, including, as examples, wind tunnels (aerospace, automotive, and motorsports), rocket test stands, climatic chambers, jet engine test cells, acoustic chambers, altitude test facilities, captive trajectory systems, and nuclear facilities. Our projects span the automotive, motorsports, defense, nuclear, and aerospace markets. Recent clients include Audi, Boeing, BMW, Fiat Chrysler, Ford, Honda, General Motors, NASA, U.S. Air Force, U.S. Navy, U.S. Department of Energy, Volkswagen, and many others in North America, Europe, and Asia.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Our capabilities and some recent project photos and videos can be found in the downloadable files at https:\u002F\u002Fjtftp.jacobstechnology.com\u002F. Use “anontg” as both the username and password.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Most of your designs will be unique, and you may work on several projects at one time in a dynamic, challenging, and even fun environment. This position will provide you with an exciting opportunity to develop and manage drawing packages and 3D models of structural projects as part of a multi-discipline team of professionals. We are looking for a structural drafter who will work to ensure client satisfaction and help deliver key structural projects within scope, budget, and schedule. You should be a self-motivated individual with at least 0 to 2 years of drafting experience and be willing to learn multiple drafting software packages.<\u002Fp> \n <p>In this role, the Structural Drafter will work closely under the direction of the Lead Designer and Structural Engineer. This role is responsible for preparing detailed construction drawings for steel and reinforced concrete structures using structural specifications, engineering calculations, sketches, and design information according to project standards and procedures.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  This position requires direct communication and coordination with other disciplines such as mechanical, electrical, piping and project team members to ensure a complete and timely production of drawing packages, spreadsheets, and databases to document information related to the design. The drafter will become familiar with work processes for the office and the department.\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <div> \n  <ul>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Due to federal requirements for portions of the assigned work US Citizenship is required.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Requires certification of two (2) years training from a vocational school or two (2) years college with courses relevant to drafting or engineering principles plus a minimum of 0 to 2 years of experience. Must have working knowledge of CAE\u002FCAD systems.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Must be able to demonstrate good leadership, organization, planning, communication, and problem-solving capability.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Requires working knowledge in the use of drafting equipment and in the application of drafting principles (descriptive geometry, lettering, dimensioning, layout, detail, etc.). A general working knowledge of shop and field erection processes associated with structural design is a plus.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Work knowledge of producing structural design and layouts is a plus (i.e. steel, concrete, beams, columns, framing plans, elevations, steel ducting, stiffeners, and connection details.)\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Requires working knowledge of AutoCad and\u002For other drafting software listed below. Working knowledge of 3D modeling and producing 2D construction drawings from the model is highly desirable (using software such as Revit, Inventor, Creo or other related software).\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n  <ul>\n   <li>\n    <div>\n     Able to produce drawings that adequately depicts the design, are clear, concise, as free from errors as possible, and meet the job standards and specifications.\n    <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  BRIEF OUTLINE OF SPECIFIC ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES \n  <b>(Reference a Project Function Job Description if applicable.):<\u002Fb> \n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  1. Performs basic drafting responsibilities with limited assignments in support of projects.\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  2. Prepares clear, accurate drawings of simple, easily visualized components from detailed sketches and\u002For written notes.\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  3. Copies finished drawings and makes simple revisions from detailed instructions.\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  4. Assists with field work associated with drawing assignment, such as field measurement and simple sketches.\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  5. Assists more senior drafters\u002Fdesigners in the acquisition of required data\u002Finformation, maintenance of files and supplies, and operation of related drafting room equipment.\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  6. Assist in the preparation of bills of materials requirement lists.\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  7. Performs other related duties as required.\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   Unusual or Special Physical Requirements of Position\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       Examples:\n      <\u002Fdiv> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       Specify\n      <\u002Fdiv> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       % of Time\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <br> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <ul>\n       <li>\n        <div>\n         Field Work\n        <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n       <li>\n        <div>\n         Special clothing\u002Fequipment Other\n        <\u002Fdiv><br> <\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div><\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n      <ul>\n       <li>\n        <div>\n         Office and computer-based work for 80 – 90% of time\n        <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n       <li>\n        <div>\n         Occasional site visits requiring general access around construction and project sites, involving ability to access upper and lower levels. 10-20% of time.\n        <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n       <li>\n        <div>\n         Special clothing\u002Fequipment and other PPE may be required during site visits (15%)\n        <\u002Fdiv> <\u002Fli>\n       <li>\n        <div>\n         Must be able to lift 50 lbs\n        <\u002Fdiv><br> <\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful>\n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <br> \n    <br> \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div><\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   Description of Work Environment\n  <\u002Fdiv> \n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       Examples:\n      <\u002Fdiv> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       Specify\n      <\u002Fdiv> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n     <div>\n      <div>\n       % of Time\n      <\u002Fdiv>\n      <br> \n     <\u002Fdiv>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <br> \n    <div>\n     <div>\n      <ul>\n       <li>\n        <div>\n         Indoors?
