<p>Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i> We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. That's why we bring a thoughtful and collaborative approach to every one of our partnerships.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> At Jacobs, we challenge the status quo and redefine how to solve the world's greatest challenges, transforming big ideas into intelligent solutions for a more connected, sustainable world.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <b> Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> This position is for an on-site job at NASA Ames Research Center in Mountain View, California. The position is to help support and oversee facility services, safety, and lab operations in the Experimental Aero-Physics Branch (Code AOX). This is an exciting opportunity to work in a facility that conducts wind tunnel experiments and provides engineering services.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div>\n  <br> This position covers the following areas:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Facility Services: Coordinates and oversees the mechanical operations, maintenance and repair of the building, facilities and components. The systems and areas of oversight include wind tunnel testing areas, storage spaces, lighting, HVAC, plumbing, electrical, fire mains, overhead cranes, and branch vehicles. The NASA Ames Facilities Services contract performs routine maintenance in some of these areas and this role will serve as a single point of contact for all outside support services.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Safety Point of Contact: The Branch Safety Point of Contact oversees all aspects of branch safety. This includes ensuring that all required federal, state and local safety rules and regulations are followed in the branch. The Safety position helps track and schedule required safety training for team members, runs the hazmat disposal program, ensures that chemical storage inventories are current, and manages lifting device equipment.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Lab Operations Oversight: This role will oversee the mechanical operations, maintenance and repair of FML research and test-related facilities. Including all wind tunnels, water channels, test instrumentation, and related equipment. These facilities are not maintained by the NASA Ames Facilities Services contract staff, therefore, this role has an active role in maintenance of the research and test related facilities.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Group Lead Position: Responsible for leading a small team on support and engineering staff. This role involves performance management, purchasing materials and services for the group, approving timecards, and reporting.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <p><b>ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  <b>Unusual or Special Physical Requirements of Position<\u002Fb>\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Lifting<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Hands on tasks<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Physical Exam Required<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Safety Training<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n  <b>Description of Work Environment<\u002Fb>\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Office<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Labs<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Model Prep. Rooms<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Control Rooms<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Wind Tunnels<\u002Fli>\n   <li>High Bay Areas<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Site Campus<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n  <b>Equipment and Machines Involved in Work Tasks<\u002Fb>\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Office Equipment<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Lab Equipment<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Model Prep. Room Equipment<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Wind Tunnel Equipment<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n  <b>Criticality of Attendance<\u002Fb>\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Day, Swing, and Grave Shifts could be required<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Timely and punctual attendance per job requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful> \n  <b>Other Essential Functions<\u002Fb>\n  <br> The Wind Tunnel Division is a dynamic work environment and may require other duties as assigned. Must be able to obtain a NASA badge and gain access to the facilities. Must be able to obtain a security clearance if required by the customer\u002Fclient.\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> A certificate, Associates Degree, or Bachelor's Degree in facility management, project management, safety, or a related field is desired. Relevant and verified course work or 3-5 years of experience in a related field could also be considered. This position requires a demonstrated understanding and experience with facility management, task management, safety principles, and working with computer systems and applications.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Experience using Microsoft Office applications and other project management tools is desired. All other experience with computers and software is a plus.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Understanding safety best practices and rules is required. Must be capable of operating equipment such as forklifts, cranes, boom lifts, and scissors lifts.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The ability to work with subject matter experts to help document issues and plan for solutions is needed. Experience with mechanical systems related to building infrastructure and mechanical equipment is a plus.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The understanding of the quality management systems like AS9100 is a plus.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Project management experience relating to planning and executing projects is needed.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The ability to lead small teams to accomplish tasks with good communication skills is needed.<\u002Fp> \n <p>This position requires the candidate to complete on the job Safety Training to perform assigned work activities.<\u002Fp> Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> Job Description:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>The responsibilities of the Special Security Technician include, but are not limited to, assisting the Special Security Officer (SSO) to ensure control of access to Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) and SCI Facilities (SCIFs); certifying and receiving SCI visitor clearances \u002F accesses; conducting SCI security briefings, indoctrinations, debriefings, training on classified material \u002F SSO-related material and topics; obtaining signed nondisclosure agreements; and providing guidance and assistance for processing SCI position and eligibility requests for assigned military, Government and contractor personnel. Serves as a CAP security specialist with emphasis on lifecycle program protection management for USSPACECOM. Reduces the chances for espionage, terrorism, and threats of unauthorized disclosure and \u002F or compromise of information or material considered vital to command mission interests, national defense or national security. Develops, implements, and integrates CAP program protection requirements in support of USSPACECOM essential program information, operations, technologies and systems during the DoD acquisition process. As the CAP \u002F Special Access Program (SAP) \u002F Special Access Required (SAR) subject matter expert, provides detailed knowledge of DoD, IC, services, and mission partners’ CAP \u002F SAP \u002F SAR policies, plans and procedures. Recommends and executes “cradle to grave” security and program protection as it relates to USSPACECOM operations and equities. Trains all associated personnel on individual CAP \u002F SAP program protection requirements and processes. Provides all CAP \u002F SAP \u002F SAR security operations and analysis decisions \u002F recommendations in appropriate formats to meet DoD and USSPACECOM requirements. Other duties may include, but are not limited to audits of classified material; inspections of classified material storage facilities \u002F SCIFs \u002F containers; and, researching and preparing classified material-related policy and management recommendations, reports and recommendations.<\u002Fp> \n <p>#cjcyber<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs’ health and welfare benefits are designed to invest in you and in the things you care about. Your health. Your well-being. Your security. Your future. Typical benefits offered include educational reimbursement, retirement benefits, employee stock purchase plan, health benefits, disability benefits, life and accident insurance, voluntary benefits, paid time off and paid holidays, and parental leave.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Typical salary range for this position is $97K to $107K and is commensurate with experience relative to the position.<br> <\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Meets all qualifications and skills of a Junior, plus:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Demonstrates comprehensive mission knowledge and skills that affirms completion of all developmental training and experiences for the labor category.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Demonstrates ability to communicate understanding from information that may be incomplete, indirect, highly complex, seemingly unrelated, and \u002F or technically advanced. Demonstrates ability to structure analysis based on trends in reporting and a range of analytic perspectives from other analysts, organizations, and intelligence disciplines.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Demonstrates ability to work independently with minimal oversight and direction.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Demonstrates ability to develop concise, insightful, and comprehensive products for defense intelligence.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Demonstrates ability to lead teams in researching multifaceted or critical problems.<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Minimum 6 years of experience relevant to the specific labor category with at least a portion of the experience within the last 2 years.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Desired Requirements:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Desired Education: Bachelor’s degree in an area related to the labor category from a college or university accredited by an agency recognized by the U.S. Department of Education.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Essential Functions<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Physical Requirements<\u002Fb>:<br> Most work will be done at a desk or computer.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Work Environment:<\u002Fb><br> General Office environment. The work environment is fast-paced and sometimes involves extreme deadline pressures. The nature of the work requires a high degree of teamwork and cooperation with other members of the staff as well as individuals across the Company and Customers.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Equipment &amp; Machines:<\u002Fb><br> General office equipment including PC\u002Flaptop, Fax, Copiers, Shredder, Printers, Telephone, and other miscellaneous office equipment.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Attendance:<\u002Fb><br> Attendance is always critical. Must be able to work a 40-hour workweek, normally Monday through Friday. However, times and days may vary depending on business requirements. Needs to be available to work overtime during critical peaks and be available to meet last minute requests for overtime should the situation occur.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Other Essential Functions:<\u002Fb><br> Must be able to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing<br> Grooming and dress must be appropriate for the position and must not impose a safety risk\u002Fhazard to the employee or others. Must put forward a professional behavior that enhances productivity and promotes teamwork and cooperation.<br> Must be able to interface with individuals at all levels of the organization both verbally and in writing. Must be well-organized with the ability to coordinate and prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously. Must work well under pressure to meet deadline requirements. Must be willing to travel as needed. Must take and pass a drug test and background check as well as a motor vehicle records check. Must be a US citizen.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Colorado Verbiage:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs’ health and welfare benefits are designed to invest in you and in the things you care about. You’ll support implementing, modifying and maintaining biochemical process designs, while assisting with the development of Process Flow Diagrams (PFDs) and Piping &amp; Instrumentation Diagrams (P&amp;IDs). You’ll have the opportunity to model and simulate complex biochemical processes, ensuring proper sequencing for unit operations, as well as develop process specifications. We’ll rely on you to ensure that design conforms to functional specifications, recognized codes and standards, and customer requirements – so we can make big impacts on the world, together.\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  Pave the way for your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div><\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n  At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. <p>Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i> We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. That's why we bring a thoughtful and collaborative approach to every one of our partnerships.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> At Jacobs, we challenge the status quo and redefine how to solve the world's greatest challenges, transforming big ideas into intelligent solutions for a more connected, sustainable world.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <b> Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Wages –$33.28 per hour <\u002Fp>\n <p>We are looking for an experienced Roof Repairer to join our team. This position performs roofig duties necessary to maintain industrial building roofs and new installations of various types and systems, at Naval Base Kitsap near Silverdale &amp; Poulsbo. Regular hours Monday-Friday with overtime available. Rewarding work with purpose – over 50 employees with 20+ years longevity proves it!<\u002Fp> \n <p>Competitive pay and top-shelf benefits package supporting our national defense. Our facilities team serves a diverse range of high-value national strategic missions, including all types of submarines, aircraft carriers, and the Puget Sound Naval Shipyard.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Benefits package with United Steelworkers valued at over $10+ \u002F hour includes:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Paid vacation. Two weeks at one year, grows to three weeks after five years and four weeks after ten<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Personal Leave 1 hour of paid Personal\u002FSick leave for every thirty (30) hours worked.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Pension and 401K<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>Medical and dental insurance<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <ul>\n  <li>11 Paid Holiday<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Summary\u002FGeneral Description of Job:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p>The Roof Repairer covers the roofs of structures with shingles, slate, asphalt or other related materials. The incumbent will also plan and estimate the tasking and material selection from blueprints and drawings, layout and job phasing.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Essential Duties &amp; Job Functions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Performs the roofing duties necessary to maintain industrial building roofs and new installations of various types and systems.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Operates equipment associated with the above processes with tar kettles, roof sweepers, cutting machines, torch equipment, standard measuring and testing equipment, power tools and associated roofer’s hand tools.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Plans and estimates tasking, material selection from blueprints and drawings, lay out and job phasing.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Performs other related duties as assigned.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>May perform work in other classifications when incidental work is necessary to the accomplishment of the work assignment. Significant work in another job classification may be required if accompanied by any wage adjustments applicable.<\u002Fp> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Accountable For:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>The proper use of tools and equipment commonly used in the roofing field. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Completing all mandated training requirements per government and management directives.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Timely and cost-effective performance of duties.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Timely completion and accuracy of all departmental work.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Dealing with a variety of people in a professional, courteous manner in diversified situations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Adherence to established company safety policies and good industrial and office safety practices. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Compliance with company Standard Operating Procedures and Personnel policies and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li>Having the ability to work well under pressure.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b> Job Requirements (Education, Experience, Professional Associations):<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Mandatory<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Four years’ experience or equivalent in the roofing trade and thorough knowledge of roofing materials.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Will be required to be trained in roof safety of fall arrest and fall restraint procedures including various equipment use and installation of same.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be familiar with the products and applications associated with the different types of roofing materials to include the following: Built up roofs, E.D.P.M., Torch down, metal roofs, tile, and composition.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be able to work at heights.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must have and maintain hand tools of the trade to perform the normal work of the classifications.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must possess and maintain valid Washington State driver's license with acceptable driving record.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must meet and maintain company physical and security requirements, including respirator qualification, and clearance eligibility when required.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be able to lift 50 pounds.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must possess good communication skills for a service team environment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to successfully pass any background checks and\u002For drug testing required on the contract.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>U.S. Citizenship.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>Jacobs <p>Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i> We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. That's why we bring a thoughtful and collaborative approach to every one of our partnerships.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> At Jacobs, we challenge the status quo and redefine how to solve the world's greatest challenges, transforming big ideas into intelligent solutions for a more connected, sustainable world.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <b> Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> The Conventional Prompt Strike Test Facility (CTF) contract supports the Naval Air Warfare Center Weapons Division (NAWCWD), Weapons and Energetics Department in China Lake, CA and Crane, IN. We maintain the highest levels of professionalism, integrity, honesty and fairness in our relationships with our customers, suppliers, subcontractors and professional associates.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Jacobs is seeking a senior-level candidate with U.S. Navy Diving experience to support the CTF team at Crane, IN. The successful candidate will demonstrate the skills necessary to operate and maintain instrumentation and equipment required to launch, track, position, and evaluate air and space vehicles. Ability to skillfully operate and work with a wide variety of hand and power tools associated with the trade. Ability to read and work from blue prints, diagrams or sketches.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Must be able to effectively communicate with external agencies, contractors, and clients both orally, with effective use of visual aids, and in writing. Must be able to use computing technology for problem analysis and solution.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  The skill set required includes, but is not limited to, the following:\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Operate, install, adjust, and maintain integrated computer\u002Fcommunications systems, consoles, simulators, and other data acquisition, test, and measurement instruments and equipment, which are used to launch, track, position, and evaluate air and space vehicles.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Vet and finalize technical documentation, standard operating procedures, Maintenance Manuals and revisions.<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <p><b><i>This list is not intended to be all-inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties and responsibilities.to the job duties.<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> .BS\u002FBA degree and 8-10 years' of related experience are required. The successful candidate will have a desire to work in a hands-on and collaborative environment. This position requires initiative, teamwork, and the ability to effectively communicate with all levels of the organization. Performance of this position requires working outdoors in various environments. U.S. Citizenship and the ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. DOD Secret Security Clearance required.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Preferred Skills and Qualifications: Demonstrated experience in DOD-related test programs are a plus. The Diver works below surface of water, using SCUBA gear (self-contained underwater breathing apparatus) or diving suit with airline extending to surface to inspect, repair, remove, and install equipment and structures. The Diver descends into water with aid of Diver Helper, and communicates with surface by signal line or telephone. This worker inspects docks, bottoms, and propellers of ships. The Diver repairs vessels below waterline, replacing missing or leaking rivets with bolts, caulks leaks in ships or caissons, guides placement of pilings for structures, such as docks, bridges, cofferdams, and oil drilling platforms, and lays, inspects, and repairs underwater pipelines, cables, and sewers, using hand tools. The Diver cuts and welds steel, using oxyacetylene cutting torch and arcwelding equipment, utilizing air balloon device for working underwater, cleans debris from intake and discharge strainers.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p><b>Essential Functions for Position<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p><b>Physical Requirements: <\u002Fb>May include lifting of weight up to forty (30) pounds as necessary.<\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <br> \n   <div><\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p><b>Work Environment: <\u002Fb>Can involve inside or outside work depending on the task. An inside environment may be a cubicle (considerations: close quarters, low to moderate noise, bright or dim lighting). Outside work may include various environmental conditions including warm and cold climates. Needs to be able to work well with co-workers and all levels of management. No hazards on job or unusual environmental conditions.<\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <br> \n   <div><\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p><b>Equipment and Machines<\u002Fb>: Ability to operate office equipment such as a personal computer, printer, copy machine, telephone, fax machine and other equipment including desk supplies and other work-related tools as required. Possess heavy and light equipment licenses, or the ability to obtain the necessary licenses.<\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p><b>Attendance: <\u002Fb>Normal hours are Monday – Thursday between 6:00am to 4:00pm during flex weeks, 6:00am to 3:00pm on non-flex weeks. Punctuality and regular attendance are necessary to meet deadlines. Must exhibit flexibility of work hours to adjust to surge situations based on critical mission requirements. With the exception of STD\u002FLTD\u002FFMLA &amp; approved time off, attendance is considered essential.<\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <br> \n   <div><\u002Fdiv>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p><b>Other Essential Functions: <\u002Fb>Must demonstrate professional behavior at all times when dealing with customers, management, and co-workers. Must have clear, concise and accurate communications skills in English, both verbal and written. Grooming and dress must be appropriate for the position and must not impose a safety risk to employees or others. Must maintain a positive work atmosphere by behaving and communicating in a professional manner. Independent personal transportation to office or work site is required. Travel (up to 10%) to and from customer locations and test locations (government and vendor) may be required to support projects. This may involve airline travel. In some cases, accommodations can possibly be made for POV, if necessary. When operating any vehicle for work purposes, must wear seat belt and in addition, no cellular devices are to be used when vehicle is in motion.<\u002Fp> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <\u002Fdiv>Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. <p>Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i> We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. This opportunity involves working as part of the Surface Mount Assembly Laboratory team to hand build prototypes &amp; legacy assemblies for internal &amp; external customers.<\u002Fp> \n <p>#rapidsolutions<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> Required<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to understand and interpret assembly drawings, bills of material, assembly schematics, shop travelers, &amp; work instructions. An eye for detail and a commitment to quality is essential.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Basic understanding of electronic &amp; mechanical components.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Basic understanding of printed circuit boards (PCB’s).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to populate and rework circuit boards with SMT components, thru-hole components, press fit components, install odd form components (connectors, heatsinks, hardware, etc.), routing &amp; staking of wires.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with soldering irons, hot air, hot tweezers, hot plates, solder pots. (JBC \u002F Weller \u002F Hakko preferred).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with hand assembly tools such as tweezers, lead forming tools such as pliers &amp; cutters, analog &amp; digital calipes.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work under a microscope for extended periods of time.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work in a dynamic environment with cross-functional teams. Must be able to support multiple projects or tasks with changing priorities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must have good communications skills and the ability to effectively report progress\u002Fproblems to the appropriate personnel.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Desire to learn new processes and become proficient in use of SMT hand assembly and inspection equipment.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Preferred<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Basic skills in Microsoft Office software products.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>J-STD-001 (Requirements for Soldered Electrical &amp; Electronic Assemblies, CIS).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>IPC-A-610 (Acceptability of Electronics Assemblies, CIS).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with advanced inspection tools (e.g. X-Ray).<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Clearance<\u002Fb>:<\u002Fp> \n <p>Clearance Requirement: CLEARABLE. This position may require the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance. Clearance processing will be completed by the U.S. Government. <p>Challenging Today. you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <b> Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Pay Rate: $23.35\u002Fhr (union position)<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Summary\u002FGeneral Description Of Job:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <p>Incumbent will receive, record, and distribute work orders to service crews based upon customers' requests for service, in accordance with Navy contractual requirements.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <h3 class=\"jobSectionHeader\"><b>Essential Duties &amp; Job Functions:<\u002Fb><\u002Fh3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Operates telephone to receive incoming requests for service, and questions caller\u002Fcustomers to determine the nature of the problem, following established procedures. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Reviews and records information in the computer as required. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Prioritizes, classifies, prepares work orders, distributes them to crews and schedules service calls, according to contractual designations. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Prepares work orders and distributes to service crew.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Keeps records of service calls and work orders. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Prepares and sends maintenance performance reports\u002Fsurveys to the government. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Utilizes a computer to update and maintain logs in database. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Gives work status, answers questions, and resolve complaints for the customer. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Provides support to government customers regarding questions about work performance, schedule and contract information.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Dispatches orders and relays messages and special instructions to mobile crews and other departments, using radio telephone equipment. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Provides pre-arrival instruction to caller, utilizing predetermined emergency gas leak protocol. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Coordinates maintenance and schedule calls for emergencies. <\u002Fli>\n <p>Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i> We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. That's why we bring a thoughtful and collaborative approach to every one of our partnerships.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> At Jacobs, we challenge the status quo and redefine how to solve the world's greatest challenges, transforming big ideas into intelligent solutions for a more connected, sustainable world.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <b> Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Jacobs Technology provides overall management and implementation of ground systems capabilities, flight hardware processing and launch operations at NASA's Kennedy Space Center in Florida. These tasks will support the International Space Station, Ground Systems Development and Operations, and the Space Launch System, Orion Multi-Purpose Crew Vehicle and Launch Services programs.<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  Serve as a Project Manager in the Ground Systems Project Management group.\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Provide Project Management oversight and assist in all aspects of a project.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Provide oversight and assist with the management of project scope, risks, budgets and schedule changes.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Provide oversight when assigned the responsibilities of establishing new project teams in support of TOSC identified requirements focusing on ensuring project management standardization and resourcing across the TOSC Project Portfolio.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Demonstrate understanding of project scheduling development and resource loading to capture all work performed in executing the project lifecycle.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Provide Project Management oversight and assist with the preparation of project artifacts to include, but not limited to, project planning artifacts, project status reports, project briefs, etc.<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Host\u002Ffacilitate project team meetings<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Coordinate project assessments<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Exercise extensive participation in management planning; continuously demonstrates effort to improve overall operations; restructures immediate and long range goals, objectives and plans<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Perform other duties as assigned<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Access to Kennedy Space Center amenities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>While doing your part to help further space exploration at Kennedy Space Center, you can enjoy many on-site amenities, such as: <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Child Development Center<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Discounted tickets to local attractions and theme parks<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Credit Union<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Fitness Center<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Barbershop<\u002Fli> \n  <li>NASA Exchanges<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Flex schedule and Telework:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we value your time and commitment. Here at Kennedy Space Center, Jacobs offers partial telework options and flexible work schedules for many of our positions. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> By joining us as a Quality Manager, you’ll be responsible for the oversight and enforcement of the Contractor’s conformance with the contact documents and for the Contractor’s implementation or qualify assurance as well as the quality control, including, but not limited to, special inspections. You’ll have full managerial responsibility for a given scope of work and the direction, control, and utilization of a staff of professionals ands support personnel.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We’ll look to your expertise to provide review of the Contractor’s Quality Program and the Contractor’s key quality management personnel such as the QM and Quality Staff for the project and provide recommendations as needed<\u002Fp> \n <p>You’ll review and approve all subcontractors and suppliers not identified in the Contractor’s proposal. Also, we’ll have you review and approve the Contractor’s Inspection and Testing Program documentation, including but not limited to the inspector\u002Ftest control documents and procedures, Qualify Work Plans (QWP), inspection checklists and records, hold points and notification of hold point activity by work site.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Help us ensure that a QWP for each definable feature of work (for one per specification section) shall be submitted at least three weeks prior to the start of work and presented by the Contractor’s and\u002For Subcontractor’s Quality Team responsible for the work at the Preparatory Phase Session. Each QWP shall be the basis for site-specific. No work is to be preformed without an approved QWP.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You’ll ensure that a preparatory session documented by attendance sheet, agenda, and meeting minutes shall be held prior to the start of an activity. The meeting shall include a discussion of the QWP, checklists for each work activity, Hold Points, quality concerns and actions to mitigate each concern, Authority’s expectations, and necessary records to be prepared and maintained. In attendance shall be, as minimum, the Contractor’s and subcontractor’s personnel involved in the activity.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Our Quality Manager shall verify that Hold Points shall be established and identified in the QWP for each first article or portion of work, including sample work\u002Fmock-ups, etc. The means and methods of communications “Hold Points” and releasing them shall be established between the Contractor and the PMC. Also, you’ll be responsible for the management of the Review Submittals process.<\u002Fp> \n <p>If the project includes commissioning with a commissioning provider or a systems integrator, the QM shall be responsible for the oversight of all pre-functional checks, inspections and tests including static tests, equipment start-up and verification of interlocks for all mechanical and electrical systems.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs health and welfare benefits are designed to invest in you, and in the things you care about. Your health. Your well-being. Your security. Your future. Typical benefits offered include flexible work schedules and opportunities to work remotely, educational reimbursement, retirement benefits, employee stock purchase plan, health benefits, disability benefits, life and accident insurance, voluntary benefits, paid time off and paid holidays, and parental leave.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Typical salary range for this position is $140,000 to $150,000- and is commensurate with experience relative to the position.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Engineering degree<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Substantial post graduate professional expertise as a quality manager<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we challenge what is currently accepted, so we can shape innovative and lasting solutions for tomorrow. Through the delivery of our operations and maintenance services, you’ll make it simpler and more seamless for our municipal clients to operate safely and efficiently, empowering communities to focus on what matters most to them – people.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>As a Sanitation Worker, you’ll join a collaborative team ensuring that our clients can deliver their services – uninterrupted. Based in US FL The Villages, you’ll have the opportunity to perform a variety of tasks in the city sanitation department. You’ll collect trash and garbage from city residents and commercial establishments onto a collection vehicle using discretion on an assigned shift. You’ll work on an assigned route as a member of a collection crew to pick up garbage and trash; clean areas of collection; clean trucks and equipment; assist with preventive maintenance checks and services (PMCS) daily; and perform other duties as required. Most importantly, you’ll take action to ensure the safety, health and well-being of your team.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Here's What You'll Need:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>A valid driver’s license with no major infractions<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Ideally, You’ll Also Have:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Basic knowledge in sanitation procedures and maintenance of equipment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Safe work practices <p>Working Conditions &amp; Physical Requirements:<\u002Fp> <p>Safety is a core value at Jacobs. We are committed to providing a safe and healthy workplace for all employees. This position will spend a substantial amount of time performing safety sensitive labor or services. Due to the nature of the job passing a Fitness for Duty testing is required to ensure candidates for this position are physically and functionally fit to perform the essential physical work functions of this safety sensitive position without posing a direct threat to the health or safety of themselves or others.<\u002Fp><br> <p><\u002Fp><p>The physical and environmental demands required to perform the essential duties of this position include standing, walking, sitting, coordination, balance and agility demands, which may include the ability to stoop, kneel, squat, grasp, reach, perform repetitive hand movements. Additional demands may involve a specific level of dexterity, grip strength, climbing and cardiorespiratory demands. The work areas may be indoor, outdoor, have loud noise, active machinery, high pressure fluid systems, electrical equipment, confined spaces, heights and depths, fumes, air borne particles, noxious gases, and chemicals. The use of appropriate safety equipment will be mandatory in these areas to prevent hazardous contact. <\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), age, medical condition, marital or domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression and transgender status, mental disability or physical disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, citizenship, low-income status or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable law. government and private <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Jacobs is currently seeking a <b>Telecommunications Specialist<\u002Fb> to join our energetic team in the Winchester, VA area. In this position you’ll be a part of a team that maintains and supports our customer’s facility by ensuring that the telecommunications systems are fully functional and available to support mission requirements. This position requires an active DoD TS\u002FSCI security clearance that has been adjudicated in the last 5 years or designated CE and the ability to obtain and maintain special accesses.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Work as the Telecommunications Specialist responsible for availability, performance and testing of operational mission capabilities under varying conditions including various IT and RF based voice, video, data systems, networks, services and information feeds.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Operate, maintain, test, analyze, troubleshoot and restore communications systems and services. Coordinate availability, performance and\u002For restoration efforts with 3rd party services providers as required.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Apply knowledge, training, and expertise to determine appropriate operational course of action and best solution set to implement under varying events and conditions, brief customer on operational status.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Make tactical decisions and take decisive action in stressed or degraded environments to ensure mission objectives are met.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage dynamic taskings and prioritize workload to meet customer expectations and demand level under changing situational conditions.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Identify and recommend process improvements, efficiency gains and innovative approaches to operations and service delivery to increase customer value.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Work with customer to determine operational requirements for future system capabilities; support the design, planning and testing of new systems to meet customer needs; ensure new systems are properly installed and brought on-line for operational use; coordinate installation team efforts to ensure schedules are met and activities are not disruptive to ongoing operations.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ensure proper configuration and change management control are applied and system documentation is current.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Position requires some travel or response to alternate locations in support of evolving customer requirements or surge demand.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Successful candidate will receive highly specialized training on unique job responsibilities.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><br> #cjcyber<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Active DoD TS\u002FSCI security clearance that has been adjudicated in the last 5 years or designated CE and the ability to obtain and maintain special accesses.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Two (2) years of college in an IT or telecommunications related field of study and three (3) years of related experience or any equivalent combination of relevant education and experience for a total of five (5) years. Progressive relevant training and\u002For certification in appropriate discipline may be substituted for one (1) year of the education or experience requirement<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Operational work experience in DOD or Intelligence Community communications technology programs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>CompTIA IT Security+ Certification, or must be able to obtain within 6 months<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Tier II, Hardware\u002FField Engineer, Network Admin or Systems Admin experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with PC\u002FLAN level maintenance, such as component replacement, cabling, switch installation, replacement of peripheral equipment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge and experience of lifecycle sustainment.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Preferred:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>B.S degree in an IT or telecommunications major and three (3) years of related experience or any equivalent combination of relevant education and experience for a total of five (7) years. Progressive relevant training and\u002For certification in appropriate discipline may be substituted for one (1) year of the education or experience requirement<\u002Fli> \n  <li>5-10 years’ experience in RF systems including HF, VHF, UHF, EHF, AEHF<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with cryptographic systems, radio systems, video teleconferencing systems, satellite systems, network architecture and\u002For inside cable plant distribution systems.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Commercial or military certificates of training in RF systems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>CompTIA A+, Net+ certification<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with Microsoft software and tools, including Windows 10 and SharePoint portal.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Instructor experience<br> <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Physical Requirements:<br> Must be able to lift and move items between 50-75lbs and should be able to lift in accordance with 2 people lift up 125-150lbs.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Work Environment:<br> General Office environment. The work environment is fast-paced and sometimes involves extreme deadline pressures. The nature of the work requires a high degree of teamwork and cooperation with other members of the staff as well as individuals across the Company and Customers.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Equipment &amp; Machines:<br> General office equipment including PC\u002Flaptop, Fax, Copiers, Shredder, Printers, Telephone, and other miscellaneous office equipment.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Attendance: Attendance is critical at all times. Must be able to work a 40-hour workweek, normally Monday through Friday. However, times and days may vary depending on business requirements. Needs to be available to work overtime during critical peaks and be available to meet last minute requests for overtime should the situation occur.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Other Essential Functions:<br> Must be able to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing<br> Grooming and dress must be appropriate for the position and must not impose a safety risk\u002Fhazard to the employee or others. Must put forward a professional behavior that enhances productivity and promotes teamwork and cooperation.<br> Must be able to interface with individuals at all levels of the organization both verbally and in writing. Must be well-organized with the ability to coordinate and prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously. Must work well under pressure to meet deadline requirements. Must be willing to travel as needed. You’ll have the opportunity to work with power system planning, power distribution, lighting design, fire and life safety systems, vertical transportation and construction coordination. We’ll rely on you to prepare load analysis for different stages of design, drawings detailing the system designed as well as prepare and document energy compliance calculations and forms.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You’ll be surrounded by expert mentorship opportunities to help you thrive in your new career. <p>Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i> We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. That's why we bring a thoughtful and collaborative approach to every one of our partnerships.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> At Jacobs, we challenge the status quo and redefine how to solve the world's greatest challenges, transforming big ideas into intelligent solutions for a more connected, sustainable world.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <b> Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> Internal Only<\u002Fb><br> Jacobs has partnered with NASA to support space flight programs for more than 40 years. While the majority of work is directly in support of LaRC, other industry partners and Government agencies may be supported at remote sites as directed by the Contracting Officer (CO). The Center Maintenance, Operations, and Engineering (CMOE) contract comprises of three major categories of work – operations, maintenance, and engineering (OME).<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Responsibilities<\u002Fb><br> As a CMOE employee, it is your primary duty and obligation to ensure your personal safety, the safety of coworkers and of customers. You will provide technical expertise for component cleaning of a variety of pressure components of different materials including those in oxygen systems. Have knowledge of various cleaning agents, solvents, and their compatibility with materials. Provide clients guidance with classification of cleanliness levels, precision and non-precision cleanliness levels. Be knowledgeable in a variety of test methods to meet client needs. Create operating procedures of current cleanroom capabilities. Be knowledgeable of client LPR 1740.5 procedure.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> Qualifications<\u002Fb><br> US Citizenship is required. A valid driver’s license is required. Minimum of 15 years’ experience or any equivalent combination of experience and training in a designated field, craft, or trade that can be documented by a certificate or diploma from a reputable organization, school, or trade program (completion of apprenticeship preferred). Must be able to effectively communicate with others and work in a team atmosphere. Previous experience in a clean room is required.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Essential Functions<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Work Environment<\u002Fb><br> Industrial Environment- May be exposed to areas of high noise levels, hazardous propellants, explosives, chemicals, steam, high pressure lines, and industrial facilities (90%)<br> Travel between various facilities and during test operations may be required and may bring exposure to loud noise and potentially hazardous equipment operation (10%)<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> <b>Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><br> Visual and physical (hands on) contact of industrial related systems, hardware, and articles.<br> Requires climbing, crawling, bending, and body mobility (30%)<br> Ability to distinguish basic colors (10%) Corrected vision (100%) Hearing (100%)<br> Requires lifting, carrying, exerting pressure up to 35lbs. (10%)<br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Equipment and Machines<\u002Fb><br> 1. Industrial facilities- will use: Hand tools\u002Fpower tools\u002Fmechanical\u002Felectrical control devices (40%)<br> 2. Personal computers, computer terminals, related equipment (20%)<br> 3. Safety and personal protective equipment (100%)<br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Attendance<\u002Fb><br> Regular attendance mandatory (100%)<br> Occasional overtime\u002Fwork outside normal schedule may be required (&lt;20%)<br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Other Essential Functions<\u002Fb><br> US Citizenship required. Must be able to work in a team atmosphere. Must put forward a professional behavior that enhances productivity and promotes teamwork and cooperation. Grooming and dress must be appropriate for the position and must not impose a safety\u002Frisk hazard to the employee or others. Must be able to obtain and maintain a security clearance as required. Employee must have a valid driver license. CMOE employees will exercise diligence when developing a Safe Plan of Action (SPA) for each task performed. Your SPA is a Company provided tool to be used for the prevention of incidents, accidents, and injuries; as such, it is the most important tool that you are required to use.<\u002Fp> Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> We are searching for a Process (chemical) Engineering Intern\u002F co-op in our San Francisco office for summer 2022.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Our core Life Sciences network has become the largest provider of engineering and construction services to pharmaceutical and biotechnology clients in the world. Jacobs provides full-service engineering, procurement, and construction management services to both new and existing facilities. For projects of every scale, we provide design, engineering, construction, commissioning, and maintenance services that support a facility's entire life cycle.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As an intern with our Life Sciences team you will work with Process Engineers in assisting them executing projects for our various clients. Work could be in the pharmaceutical, biotech, or chemical industries. Some tasks may include elementary process calculations, CADDing of drawings, maintaining equipment\u002Fline lists, creating flow diagrams, and coordinating with other disciplines. You may even have an opportunity to visit an on-going project site to engage in construction activities and provide field support.<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Typical salary range for this position is $24.00 - $29.00\u002Fhr and is commensurate with experience relative to the position. For “remote” positions, salary to be offered is geographic dependent.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Engineering student working towards a BS or MS in Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or Biochemical Engineering at a 4 year accredited university is required. 3rd year student or higher preferred.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Ideally you will also have<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Minimum GPA of 3.0<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prior internship experience, especially in the pharmaceutical industry<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), age, medical condition, marital or domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression and transgender status, mental disability or physical disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, citizenship, low-income status or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable law. Learn more about your rights under Federal EEO laws and supplemental language.\n <p><i><br> At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the <p>Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i> We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. That's why we bring a thoughtful and collaborative approach to every one of our partnerships.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> At Jacobs, we challenge the status quo and redefine how to solve the world's greatest challenges, transforming big ideas into intelligent solutions for a more connected, sustainable world.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <b> Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Are you passionate about human space exploration, understanding the origins of the universe, and working with a passionate and diverse team to make a difference? If you are, we need you!<\u002Fp> \n <p>We need your talent, teamwork, and energy to help us achieve great things that inspire people all over the globe. We need you to bring creative ideas and diverse backgrounds to help us envision, shape, and deliver systems that will enable the exploration of space while benefiting people here on Earth. We are excited about what we do, and we need you on our team as we take on exciting challenges for NASA’s pursuits in deep space exploration. Jacobs is NASA’s largest engineering solutions provider working together with NASA at centers across the United States.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We have an exciting opportunity for a <b>Science Coordinator <\u002Fb>to join our team with JETS II Teammate Company, <b>Barrios Technology, Inc.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>The Science Coordinator will:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Provide lunar mission science, logistics, and business services to a range of NASA's human exploration organizations <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Provide technical review, preparation, and development of scientific, engineering, and technical documents <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Prepare schedules and track actions for reporting<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Maintain SharePoint action and event tracker for Artemis Program activities<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Investigate science mission operations concepts, software tools, and methodologies for lunar and Mars mission scenarios <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Integrate science community documents into flight systems and human and robotic planetary exploration requirements. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Perform other tasks assigned.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> Requisition Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><i>This position has been posted at multiple levels. Depending on the candidate's experience, requirements, and business needs, we reserve the right to consider candidates at any level for which this position has been advertised.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>BS degree from an accredited college or university in an associated technical discipline<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Scientific or technical writing, publication submissions, and proposal development <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience coordinating meetings and services across multiple organizations or groups <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ability to develop innovative work ideas and work without specific tasking <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Proficient computer skills (i.e. Microsoft Office suite, file\u002Fimage editing with Adobe products) <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal skills <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ability to work on a team and lead tasks when necessary <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Highly organized with attention to detail <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Requisition Preferences: <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Bachelor’s in science and\u002For business <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Budget and\u002For project management<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Mission science integration and operations <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Knowledge of Earth and lunar science <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Scientific field work, laboratory, image science, and\u002For remote sensing experience <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Proficiency with web-based collaborative platforms (e.g. wiki, SharePoint, Microsoft Teams) <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Prior NASA experience<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Why Join Our Team?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Click on the below links to view just a small sample of all that we do! We look forward to seeing you!<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>See What We Do<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs Aerospace Solutions Overview <br> (Please view in Chrome or Microsoft Edge)<\u002Fp> \n <p>In addition to exciting career opportunities, we also have: <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Excellent personal and professional career growth <\u002Fli>\n  <li>9\u002F80 work schedule (every other Friday off) <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Onsite cafeteria (breakfast &amp; lunch) <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Much, much more! <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p>For more information on our partnership with NASA at Johnson Space Center (JSC), please visit www.wehavespaceforyou.com<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Must be able to complete a U.S. government background investigation.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Management has the prerogative to select at any level for which the position is advertised.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Essential Functions<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Work Environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Generally, an office environment, but can involve inside or outside work depending on task. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Work may involve sitting or standing for extended periods (90% of time). <p>Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i> We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. Able to travel to TDY locations 25% of the time.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Employee will be responsible for the setup, configuration and administration of servers and user level computers in specialized closed networks.<br> Administration will be primarily but not limited to Windows based. Employee may work with a team and be responsible for packaging network components for shipment or travel to TDY locations. Employee may also be responsible for equipment setup at TDY location, maintaining equipment inventory, teardown and repackaging for shipment back to home station.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> Required Education, Training, and Experience:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Bachelor's Degree in a related discipline, or any equivalent combination of relevant education and experience.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Additional Skills desired are: Security +; DCGS-A experience; Military experience (35T preferred); Test experience, Elastic Stack or some Java experience.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p><b>Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p>Work may involve sitting or standing for extended periods of time. Regular hours will be 40 hours\u002Fweek Monday – Friday with every other Friday off. Regular attendance of scheduled hours is extremely important. Punctuality and regular attendance is required. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <div>\n  <br> \n  <p>At Jacobs, our Program Management and Construction Management (PM\u002FCM) team works seamlessly with clients by delivering projects and programs to achieve our clients’ goals. Whether it’s managing construction or designing buildings, solutions are continuously being implemented. What we do is more than construction; we play a part in moving a vision from concept to reality. If you’re interested in a rewarding career working on ENR's #1 Program Management and Construction Management-for-Fee firm, then Jacobs is where you belong<\u002Fp> \n  <p>We are looking for an experienced and collaborative <b>Scheduling Manager<\u002Fb> to support our Program Management Team onsite with our client in <b>Chicago, IL<\u002Fb>. As a key member of our team, you’ll mentor\u002Fsupervise other schedulers, interact with engineering and construction to understand and communicate issues and conflicts that impact the schedule, working within Primavera (P6), organize and document Interactive Planning Sessions (IAP) with project stakeholders, and support overlapping project scheduling tasks, issue management, meeting facilitation, document control and monthly status reporting to the Project Management Team. You will also utilize your expertise to analyze CPM schedules, recommend workarounds and schedule improvements, present project trends and forecast performance reports to management and to make recommendations on strategies to resolve project issues. You will supervise the scheduling effort on large program with increasing complexity and serve as a technical expert in scheduling. You will maintain the program master schedule encompassing all program projects, critical activities, milestones, and interfaces. You will review and incorporate scheduling information from design and construction teams into master schedule and evaluate variance reports showing changes from previously submitted schedules. <\u002Fp>\n  <p>The scheduling manager will undertake the forensic schedule analysis effort and be responsible for conducting schedule impact analysis and review of claims, change orders, engineers’ bulletins and updates, and will provide written recommendation on entitlement. Additionally, you'll manage program progress reporting by create reports, spreadsheets, and logs, and prepare, coordinate and deliver program and project scheduling presentations to internal management and client. You'll monitor earned value systems that accurately measure progress and performance; and analyze the data to lead project controls staff and the project team. The position requires full understanding of earned-value concepts and terms and the ability to analyze contractor’s schedule progress and performance, identify potential issues and problem areas, and provide reports to the project management team and client. <\u002Fp>\n  <p>Pave the way for your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work with opportunities to share your knowledge along the way.<\u002Fp> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor degree in an Engineering discipline, Construction Management, or related field <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Minimum of 15 years of progressive experience in scheduling in the construction and\u002For engineering field with increasing responsibility<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience managing scheduling on large programs with budgets exceeding $1 billion<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prior people leader experience managing a scheduling team<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Understand the relationships between the project controls functions: estimating, planning\u002Fscheduling, cost control, and risk management<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to understand contracts and interpret from scheduling\u002Fproject controls perspective<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Expert level user of Primavera P6, previous experience in resource and cost loading P6 schedules, recording cost actuals and setting up time periods in P6<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experienced in reviewing and approving contractor’s and consultant’s baseline schedules<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Display a clear and analytical approach to problem solving, and strong decision-making <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Excellent communication and presentation skills and be able to effectively communicate complex scheduling information to varied audiences including engineering, project\u002Fconstruction management, and project teams<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with emerging business\u002Findustry trends and the implications for scheduling<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Ideally, You’ll Also Have:<\u002Fb> <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Project Management Professional (PMP) certified<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Working knowledge of Project Management Institute (PMI) principles<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Forward-thinking, eager to learn best practices, and contribute with innovative ideas<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other. <\u002Fp>\n <p>#BIA #NorthPMCM<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <p><i>At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the government and private <p>Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i> We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. That's why we bring a thoughtful and collaborative approach to every one of our partnerships.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> At Jacobs, we challenge the status quo and redefine how to solve the world's greatest challenges, transforming big ideas into intelligent solutions for a more connected, sustainable world.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <b> Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Works with the Program Manager and Maintenance Supervisor to plan and lead the maintenance group responsible for operational maintenance and improvements at NASA's Ames Research Center, Moffett Field, CA. Safe operation through training, procedural emphasis, and personal commitment critical. Responsible for skill and safety training and certification of facility engineers and unionized tradesmen assigned to scheduled and unscheduled maintenance tasks. Manages resources (labor, equipment, vehicles, parts, materials, etc.) within the assigned budget. Guides maintenance engineers and technicians in the use of RCM methodologies to enhance facility availability and reliability. Ensures planning and scheduling of preventive maintenance and projects to maximize efficiency and reliability of equipment. Responsible for safe and efficient use of specialty subcontractors for facility asset management of elevators, cranes\u002Flifting devices, compressor and related pressure vessel maintenance, transformer maintenance, etc. Interacts closely with customers to plan and prioritize work and ensure quality on-time maintenance and project completion.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Two-year Associate degree or four-year Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 8 years’ experience in the leadership of a maintenance organization providing scheduled preventive maintenance, unscheduled trouble call repairs, and funded project work. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in safety, experience leading unionized tradesmen (plumbers, electricians, alarm technicians, HVAC technicians, carpenters, etc.), and experience with Computerized Maintenance Management Systems (CMMS). CMRP or CRL certification preferred.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Skills required include:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Absolute commitment to safety <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Effective written and verbal communication<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Strong organizational skills with good attention to detail<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Self-motivated and takes initiative to solve problems as required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to maintain a positive and professional attitude on all assignments<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Tact, diplomacy, and proficiency in collaborating and communicating with all levels of staff <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ability to work with union leadership to resolve union related issues such as grievances<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Build positive\u002Feffective relationships with clients<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Essential Functions<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Use of appropriate PPE (footwear, safety glasses, gloves, hearing protection, etc.) <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Work in an office environment and in the field daily.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Use PC and software (Microsoft Office 365, CMMS, etc.), and other standard office equipment. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Must be able to obtain a Federal Access Clearance<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must take and pass pre-employment screening, drug screening and background check.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>This work is 100% on-site, Moffett Field, Ca. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer.
