<p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> The energy industry is undergoing rapid and dramatic changes, moving away from fossil fuels to alternative energy sources. At the same time, the risks posed by climate change and aging infrastructure requires an array of dynamic and innovative solutions to deliver resilient utility services.<\u002Fp> \n <p>This great energy transition is still in its early stages, and presents significant technical, logistical, and market challenges. Decarbonization will require detailed planning, multi-disciplinary collaboration, significant financial resources, and motivated staff to support successful implementation. Jacobs is expanding our team to tackle the complexities of decarbonization to deliver a cleaner and more secure energy future.<\u002Fp> \n <p>By joining our team, we’ll harness your expertise as a distribution engineer to help deliver client programs and projects. As a Distribution Engineer, you’ll work closely across operations, sales, and technology functions providing leadership as we expand our energy transitions portfolio. You can be based anywhere in North America.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Your primary responsibilities will focus upon 1) delivery of electrical distribution engineering projects for utility, industrial and municipal clients, 2) assistance in development of internal capability to address the significant infrastructure investments utilities are making to increase resilience and incorporate distributed energy across their networks.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Other responsibilities will include collaboration with global resources to develop a best-in-class transmission and distribution engineering design practice within the firm.<\u002Fp> \n <p>If you are excited by the possibilities of a carbon-free energy future, motivated by a challenge, and enjoy working with a dynamic, multi-disciplinary team to develop innovative solutions, Jacobs is the place for you. Come join our growing team to realize the future of energy!<\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs health and welfare benefits are designed to invest in you, and in the things you care about. Your health. Your well-being. Your security. Your future. Typical benefits offered include flexible work schedules and opportunities to work remotely, educational reimbursement, retirement benefits, employee stock purchase plan, health benefits, disability benefits, life and accident insurance, voluntary benefits, paid time off and paid holidays, and parental leave.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Typical salary range for this position is $85,000 to $130,000- and is commensurate with experience relative to the position.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Post graduate substantial years of design experience working with utility clients and transmission and distribution projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Expertise in CYME, ETAP, Aspen, Powerworld and other leading power engineering software focused to the power T&amp;D Utility Industry<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Industry experience across a broad range of investor-owned utilities<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Knowledge of transmission and distribution design standards across the broader power\u002Futility market space<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Strong communication and technical writing skills<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we solve the most important problems. We create solutions for the real world – making life simpler and more seamless along the way. We’re united by the drive to dream big while keeping our feet firmly planted on the ground.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Our Client Deliverables Solutions (CDS) is a team of storytellers, helping our project teams convey the message of the work we do at Jacobs. CDS provides professional editing, writing, graphic design, and document publishing services to enhance our contracted client-facing documents. As a part of our CDS team, you’ll influence materials ranging from project communications for a highly technical audience to public-facing documents that present technical information in an approachable, understandable way. From multivolume regulatory submittals to straightforward memos and project reports, you’ll partner with project teams to develop and deliver quality, consistent, and cost-effective work products, demonstrating how Jacobs is challenging today and reinventing tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As a Technical Writer\u002FEditor, you’ll help develop and deliver everything from short-term local projects to long-term, complex programs that encompass work around the globe. You’re comfortable interviewing and working with subject matter experts and crafting their stories into content they can then review and round out. From writing to revising for a unified voice, to editing for clarity and consistency, you’ve got the fundamental skills to make complex content readable and relatable for various audiences. You’re a self-starter, eager to demonstrate your creative communication solutions, tackling challenges, crushing deadlines, and far exceeding client expectations along the way. Your collaboration with graphic design, document publishing, and production staff will contribute to the success of your team and polish the brand of #OurJacobs.#LI-Remote<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor's degree in English, Journalism, Communications, or related discipline from an accredited college or university<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience editing technical (non-IT) or industry-based documents in a professional environment<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience writing content (in collaboration with subject matter experts) for various uses, including award and grant applications, white papers, training modules, video scripts, fact sheets, and brochures<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience combining the contributions of multiple technical authors to create narratives with a unified “voice”<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience managing all aspects of a deliverable program (developing outlines and templates, managing files and version control, establishing and communicating program standards and styles, adhering to budget and schedule, and communicating with project teams and colleagues in various venues)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated time management skills, to include completing work on time, scaling your approach to suit the project schedule, collaborating with colleagues to balance workload, and relying on standard processes and tools to make your time as efficient as possible.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A commitment to providing the best quality work you can in the time provided for the work, to include engaging in quality reviews and implementing feedback<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Flexibility to work occasional evenings and weekends when our success depends on you<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>To be successful in this role, you should be familiar with:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Microsoft Office (especially Word, PowerPoint, and Excel)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Adobe publishing programs (specifically Acrobat; knowledge of InDesign, Illustrator, and Photoshop is a plus)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Standard editing conventions, such as those in the current edition of The Chicago Manual of Style or the Associated Press Stylebook<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Grammatical rules, clear and concise writing, and references and citations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Shared workspace platforms (SharePoint, ProjectWise, and Teams), visual mediums, and delivery options<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Section 508 Accessibility Compliance<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), age, medical condition, marital or domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression and transgender status, mental disability or physical disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, citizenship, low-income status or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable law. Learn more about your rights under Federal EEO laws and supplemental language.\n <p><i><br> At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, our Program Management team works seamlessly with clients by delivering projects and programs to achieve our clients’ goals. If you’re interested in a rewarding career working on ENR's #1 Program Management firm, then Jacobs is where you belong! <\u002Fp>\n <p>Our Program Management team is looking for an experienced <b>Wellbeing Lead<\u002Fb> to join our collaborative team onsite at our client’s office in <b>Pittsburgh, PA<\u002Fb>. This position will report directly into the Vice President of Global Wellbeing at Jacobs, and will work closely with Jacobs’ Mental Health Lead, regional health, safety and environment leadership, and local physical wellbeing staff. In this role you’ll use your vast experience to create comprehensive plans, lead assigned personnel, monitor progress, communicate with stakeholders, provide updates to client and leadership, and assign resources for the successful execution of high value strategies and programs related to employee wellbeing initiatives. Your efforts will help improve the long-term health of employees and reduce employee healthcare costs accomplished through preventive care activities with measurable results. <\u002Fp>\n <p>You’ll lead the execution and delivery of integrated and comprehensive programs to improve the health and well-being of employees using your knowledge of health standards, wellbeing principles and safety protocols. This includes relationship management, program oversight and operations, employee engagement, outcome reporting, and continuous quality improvement. You’ll work with client representatives and other wellbeing professionals to develop creative and engaging communication strategies to increase awareness and participation in health and wellbeing initiatives, continuously fostering a culture of health, and ensuring program success and growth. <\u002Fp>\n <p>You’ll design and develop strategic plans for health and wellbeing programming and develop wellbeing policies and procedures, create and coordinate wellbeing initiatives\u002Fprojects, wellbeing meetings, provide health and wellbeing education, serving as a resource to others by maintaining up-to-date knowledge of corporate wellbeing reform and stay abreast of new trends and opportunities for future growth of the program.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You’ll create reports on participation, activities, and results to date; develop dashboard metrics for review to leadership, interpreting results and providing action plans. You’ll interpret employee feedback to determine if\u002Fhow the service might be improved in the future by analyzing statistical information from program results to identify trends and utilization in order to track progress and future programming needs that fit within the health and productivity business plan and budget.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Your role keeps our company connected and we’ll support you with what you need to be successful.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor degree in Public or Community Health, Health Education, Health Administration, Exercise Science, Nutrition or Human Resources with appropriate body accreditations <\u002Fli>\n  <li>10+ year’s operational experience in corporate or wellbeing program development and implementation is desired<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Demonstrated success in designing customized health and wellbeing promotion solutions<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of wellbeing program models, trends and best practices with emphasis on implementation of program design, educational offerings, and prevention strategies<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Display genuine focus on building trusting relationships and rapport with employees, internal partners and external vendors including wellbeing service providers<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Skilled in preparing, reviewing, and analyzing operational and financial reports<\u002Fli> \n engagement<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Significant program management experience<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Solution oriented with flexibility in problem solving, using collaborative techniques to identify problems and implement solutions<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Excellent communicator, effective in both oral and written form at all levels of the organization; able to communicate in a clear, concise and professional The candidate will act as a CLS Contract Team Manager for the unit they are assigned to. <\u002Fp>\n <p>The ideal candidate will possess current knowledge and experience in the use of LOGAIS systems, USMC logistics operations, and have prior senior level headquarter and\u002For battalion level staff experience. <\u002Fp>\n <p>The candidate must maintain a valid driver’s license and be able to obtain an operator’s license for non-tactical and tactical equipment.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Minimum Education\u002FExperience Requirements:<\u002Fb> Bachelor’s Degree and eight (8) years of relevant, progressive experience and\u002For equivalent combination of education and experience.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Qualifications - External<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Must possess an active Secret Security Clearance.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Essential Functions<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Work Environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Work will be performed in a cubical environment inside a large facility. Some travel may be required based on client requirements.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Physical Requirements<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Sitting at desk. Phone use and PC or laptop. Filing required. Must be well organized with the ability to coordinate, prioritize and execute multiple tasks simultaneously in a high-pressure environment. Ability to communicate verbally and in writing to work effectively with a variety of government, military and contractor personnel at all levels. Must be able to interface effectively with individuals at all levels of the organization. Grooming and dress usually business casual, but dependent on client’s standards. Must not pose a safety hazard to employees working in the same general area.<br> <br> The position for which you are applying for requires a US government security clearance. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we challenge what is currently accepted, so we can shape innovative and lasting solutions for tomorrow. Through the delivery of our operations and maintenance services, you’ll make it simpler and more seamless for our municipal clients to operate safely and efficiently, empowering communities to focus on what matters most to them – people.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As an Operator, you’ll join a collaborative team ensuring that our clients can deliver their services – uninterrupted. We have opportunities for Operators all over the United States, so if you are looking for a new adventure where you’ll perform a variety of tasks in the operation and maintenance of a water\u002F wastewater treatment plant including maintenance of equipment, quality control\u002Ftesting and day-to-day activities on an assigned shift, submit your application for consideration .<\u002Fp> \n <div>\n  We are looking for individuals with all levels of water\u002Fwastewater treatment certifications.\n  <br> \n  <br> Essential Duties and Responsibilities\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Operates treatment facilities to control flow and processing of water\u002F wastewater, sludge, and effluent<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Monitors gauges, meters, and control panels<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Observes variations in operating conditions and interprets meter and gauge readings<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Operates valves and gates either manually or by remote control<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Starts and stops pump, engines, and generators to control and adjust flow and treat¬ment processes<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Maintains shift log and records meter and gauge readings<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Collects samples and performs routine laboratory tests and analyses<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Performs routine maintenance functions and custodial duties<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Makes operating decisions in absence of supervisory personnel<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Understands and carries out oral and written directions<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Establishes and maintains cooperative relationships with co-workers and all those contacted during the course of work<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Performs other duties as required<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <p><b>**This posting is to collect resumes of interested Operators for opportunities with Jacobs.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b>#OMFSHotJobs #ourjacobs<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> High school diploma or GED<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Any Class\u002FGrade Water Operator and\u002For Class\u002FGrade Wastewater Operator<\u002Fli>\n  <li>At least One year of experience in operating water\u002Fwastewater treatment plants<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Possess a valid driver’s license<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <p><b>Ideally, You'll Also Have:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Basic familiarity of the principles and practices of water\u002Fwastewater treatment plant operations; operating principles of valves, pumps, and motors; principles and methods of bacteriological and chemical sewage analyses; effects and problems of industrial waste in water\u002Fwastewater treatment processes; safe work practices<\u002Fli>\n  <li>Knowledge of computer software including but not limited to Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, data management systems and be able to operate plant PLC’s and SCADA systems<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful> \n <p>Working Conditions &amp; Physical Requirements<br> The work area can involve a working environment indoors as well as outdoors, which could cause exposure to outdoor elements; proper environmental attire will be required. Some areas can have loud noise, active machinery, high pressure fluid systems, electrical equipment, confined spaces, heights and depths, fumes, air borne particles, noxious gases, pathogens and various chemicals. The use of appropriate safety equipment will be mandatory in these areas to prevent hazardous contact.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Must be able to sit, stand, stoop, twist and bend at the waist, turn, kneel, squat, raise arms above shoulder height, grasp, reach, perform repetitive hand movements and fine coordination to work on equipment, have vision sufficient to service equipment, have hearing in the normal range with or without correction. In an 8-hour shift must be able to transport self across the facility, ascend and descend stair steps, lift objects up to 50 pounds from floor level to waist height, push a push-type mower; wear and use appropriate safety equipment.<\u002Fp> Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we challenge what is currently accepted, so we can shape innovative and lasting solutions for tomorrow. If you’re interested in a rewarding career working with the industry’s best and most innovative engineers, then Jacobs is where you belong. Join a company invested in you, your success and the global community, join us as a the Land Survey Crew Leader in Litlle Rock, AR.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We are looking for a dedicated Land Survey Crew Leader to grow with our collaborative team and work on a variety of projects. Under the direction of the Professional Surveyor, you will be responsible for the supervision and training of the survey crew in conducting all phases of surveys including Control Surveys to perform EDM, Elevation Control – Three Wire Level, Photogrammetric Mapping Targets, and Levels, Design Surveys to perform Topography and Terrain Data Collection, and Land Surveys to perform Parcel Surveys, Right-of-Way Staking, Right-of-Way Monument and Final Plat.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Here's what you'll do:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Supervise and conduct, depending on the specialty (location, land, or geodetic) roadway, bridge, parcel, photogrammetric, and geodetic control surveys.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Use computer for data processing, coordinate geometry computations, and computer-aided design and drafting (CADD).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Obtain hydraulic information.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Locate and reference existing land and property corners.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Stake and monument highway rights of way.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Train, mentor, provide technical assistance to and maintain a survey crew.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepare and maintain daily work, expense, vehicle and equipment reports.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Operate computer, electronic data collector, and computer-aided drafting and design (CADD) workstation<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in surveying or related field, OR the educational equivalent to a diploma from an accredited high school and four years of directly related experience. Experience conducting surveys for highway locations, bridge, land, and control surveys.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Extensive knowledge of survey principles and practices<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficiency in computations for highway route locations and parcel surveys.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Extensive knowledge of the functions of a survey crew<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficiency in the use, care and operation of high-tech survey equipment, calculators, automated data collection system, coordinate geometry computations, and CADD.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Proficiency in reading, understanding, and plotting land descriptions. Mathematical skills through trigonometry.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Valid driver’s license<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Physical requirements:<\u002Fb><br> Physical ability to work with hand tools. Ability to traverse over rugged terrain, through water and work in an outdoor environment. Ability to stand and operate surveying equipment for at least two hours at a time. Ability to carry 50 pounds of equipment and supplies with or without reasonable accommodation.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Working conditions:<\u002Fb><br> Ability to perform assigned duties in all types of weather as well as other work conditions, e.g. noise, dust, fumes, etc. Constant statewide travel.<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp> Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. <p>Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i> We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. That's why we bring a thoughtful and collaborative approach to every one of our partnerships.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> At Jacobs, we challenge the status quo and redefine how to solve the world's greatest challenges, transforming big ideas into intelligent solutions for a more connected, sustainable world.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <b> Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><i><br> Jacobs is the world’s top supplier of automotive test facilities, providing a full range of services to commercial automotive industry customers<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>. Customers include not only the world’s major vehicle providers and other original equipment manufacturers (OEMs), but also clients from the international motor sports community.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Our experience encompasses virtually every type of automotive test facility, including climatic and driveability wind tunnels; aerodynamic, acoustic, and thermodynamic wind tunnels; emissions test rooms; soak rooms; altitude chambers; engine and powertrain test cells; and electromagnetic anechoic chambers. <b><i>We not only design and build these facility systems assets but also operate, maintain, and manage these facilities.<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i>#fordtestgroup<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>#fordtestgroup #FordTech #EPICFord #EPICTech #LI-DH1<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>JACOBS IS SEEKING A BATTERY LAB TEST TECHNICIAN IN THE AUTOMOTIVE TEST LABS IN ALLEN PARK, MI<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i>This is a great opportunity for anyone who wants to work on the battery pack systems for hybrid and Electric Vehicles. You will be working in a recently expanded state of the art facility, using the latest technologies to help create the vehicles of the future.<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>THIS POSITION INCLUDES A $750. SIGNING BONUS<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>BRIEF OUTLINE OF SPECIFIC ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Description:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b><i>Battery Cell Integration Lab (BCIL) Test Operator is responsible for supporting the Design Verification (DV) physical testing, and certification of traction battery pack systems for hybrid and electric vehicles. You work hand-in-hand with test and design engineers to support the company's product testing needs to support execution of functional, safety, and thermal performance tests on battery pack systems.<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>You will be required to become proficient in test site installation, equipment\u002Finstrumentation connection, proper functional verification of test set-up, and start-up of the site automation system (Lynx). Becoming safety certified to perform high voltage electrical and mechanical tests is required upon start-up.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Job Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Setting up Standard Lynx Automation Test Scripts to Test Request parameters<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Installation of supplemental site controls and associated I\u002FO to support test execution<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepare test samples (as required) in accordance with test instructions adhering to established standards and procedures.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Validation of proper test run through periodic monitoring of signals and cycle targets; intervening when proper run is visibly in question, with notification to the assigned Test Engineer<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist other technicians in the day-to-day execution of testing as needed<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Manage and maintain lab equipment inventory, installation, and usage; including proper adherence to Calibration and Maintenance requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Adhere to all Lab Procedures; suggest process improvements where evident<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Comply with all Environmental, Health, &amp; Safety, and ISO documented procedures<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Basic instrumentation, pack and test setups<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Determine whether the test cell is running in accordance with test procedures and react accordingly.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>This position is full-time. This is NOT a contract position.<\u002Fb> You will be eligible for our generous benefit package, including health insurance, dental, vision, generous PTO, paid holidays, 401K, stock purchase plan, and tuition reimbursement.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> MINIMUM EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, TRAINING, AND \u002FOR SKILL REQUIREMENTS:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li><b><i>High school diploma required<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fli> \n  <li><b><i>Minimum of two (2) years of related experience or vocational training. Associates technical degree a plus.<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><\u002Fli> \n  <li>High school diploma required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Basic electrical and electronics, instrumentation and troubleshooting skills<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to work independently and in a team environment, taking direction from multiple sources as needed<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Basic MS Office skills in Word and Excel required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Familiarity with schematics and wiring<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Fork Truck Experience<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Desired:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Laboratory test experience with demonstrated ability to set-up and run automated testing<\u002Fli> \n  <li>An understanding of vehicle powertrain, power supply, and vehicle electrical system operation with an emphasis on High Voltage \u002F HEV \u002F BEV applications a plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A working knowledge of instrumentation measurement systems, particularly transducers and their operation – temperature, pressure, fluid flow, et al.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Fabrication skills a strong plus<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Associate technical degree or equivalent experience a plus<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Unusual or Special Physical Requirements of Position<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Lifting: Up to 50 lbs, 50%<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Climbing: In, on, under, and around vehicles – 20%<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Crawling: Around vehicle test setups, vehicle hoists, etc. – 20%<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Special clothing\u002Fequipment (wearing): Safety glasses and steel toe shoes – 20%. Bump cap and gloves when working on vehicles – 10%<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Unusual physical requirements: Climb ladders, reaching over \u002F on top of vehicles – 10%, Laying under vehicles for tie-downs\u002Finstrumentation – 10%<\u002Fli> \n  <li>High noise level: Hearing protection provided when needed – 2%<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Other: Sitting (50%), Standing (50%), Bending (25%), stooping (25%). Job requires manual labor<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Description of Work Environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Inside? Outside? Combination? Where?: Indoors in Garage and vehicle test chamber, ambient temperatures - 95%. Outside work (summer and winter) – 5%<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Extreme (hot\u002Fcold) temperatures involved: NA<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Hazardous conditions - What are they?: Hands on working with high power RF equipment (amplifiers, power meters, coax cables, etc) – 40%<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Travel\u002Ftransportation requirements: Periodic local travel (for work, training, marketing, etc.) - 5%<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Other: NA<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Equipment and Machines Involved in Work Tasks<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Office equipment\u002Fmachines electrically\u002Fbattery operated - which?: Office equipment (copiers, fax machines, scanners, etc.) – 20%<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Vehicles, forklifts, etc. operated which?: Fork lifts – 5%, Vehicles hoists – 5%, Vehicle chassis dynamometer – 40%<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Tools used in trade - which ones?: Hand tools and electrical tools (soldering iron, etc.) – 15%, RF instrumentation (amplifiers, power meters, etc.) – 40%<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Other: NA<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Criticality of Attendance<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Overtime, regular days, off days: Must be able to work any shift to accommodate test\u002Fcustomer need. <p>Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i> We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. That's why we bring a thoughtful and collaborative approach to every one of our partnerships.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> At Jacobs, we challenge the status quo and redefine how to solve the world's greatest challenges, transforming big ideas into intelligent solutions for a more connected, sustainable world.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <b> Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Jacobs Telecommunication has been at the forefront of creating a new generation of wireless communication infrastructure for over 40 years. As the 2021 #1 Design Firm in Engineering News-Record, we specialize in everything from network development to complete telecom life cycle solutions. While the wireless world is ever changing, the demand for innovative technology and long-term support services remains constant. These services include site acquisition, design and construction, to full operations, maintenance, and deconstruction.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Position Summary<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Our graduate hire positions are for those who have recently graduated and are looking to launch their career. Regional programs and opportunities are available in a variety of fields. There’s a good chance we have an opportunity that’s just right for you.<br> <br> The selected candidate will be assigned to one of our functional groups in an Entry Level Construction Management position and asked to assist in estimating, cost control, forecasting, trend analysis, change order control, risk assessment and management, forensic schedule analysis, earned value management, progress measurement\u002Freporting, productivity analysis and calculation, subcontractor management, schedule development, progress reporting, vendor management, field engineering, site safety and overall product quality.<br> <br> Join the team in the Morristown NJ market on a wireless telecom project where you will be assisting the group with engineering and constructing the expansion of a wireless network. This position will work remotely but may require meeting in an office environment as needed.<br> <br> <b>Local Candidates will only be considered as this position will be supporting projects in the NJ\u002FNY market.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Jacobs health and welfare benefit are designed to invest in you, and in the things you care about. Your health. Your well-being. Your security. Your future. Typical benefits offered include flexible work schedules and opportunities to work remotely, educational reimbursement, retirement benefits, employee stock purchase plan, health benefits, disability benefits, life and accident insurance, voluntary benefits, paid time off and paid holidays, and parental leave. Salary offer is geographic dependent.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Construction management, electronics or technical certification required (graduated 2020+) in a 2-year+ program.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Computer literate and proficient with Word and Excel required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Valid driver's license<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to travel as needed<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Local candidates only (no relocation assistance available)<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be able maintain efficiency and productivity in a fast-paced work environment and effectively communicate with other project members as required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be eligible to work for any US Employer without current or future visa sponsorship<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>At Jacobs, we help prepare people for new opportunities and challenges. With positions at every level, openings in multiple disciplines, expertise in a range of markets and offices around the globe, we create an environment where you can learn, grow, and thrive. From our competitive benefits program to our Health and Safety initiative of Beyond Zero workplace injuries, we believe that you’ll find a flourishing career here at Jacobs.<br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>Essential Functions: Intermittent sitting, walking, standing, bending, squatting, climbing, kneeling, twisting, and lifting to 20 pounds. Hand manipulation is required for grasping, pushing and pulling, and fine manipulation. Right and\u002For left hands utilized. Need to reach and\u002For work above the shoulder, as well as below the shoulder for same. Must be alert to equipment in the field, there will be travel, will work near construction job site equipment when in the field, occasional need to work near hazardous equipment and machinery, occasional need to walk on uneven ground, exposure to dust, gas or fumes, exposure to noise, extremes in temperature or humidity, and work at heights.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><br> #telecomjobs <\u002Fp>Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. <p>Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i> We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. That's why we bring a thoughtful and collaborative approach to every one of our partnerships.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> At Jacobs, we challenge the status quo and redefine how to solve the world's greatest challenges, transforming big ideas into intelligent solutions for a more connected, sustainable world.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <b> Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> The successful candidate for this position will work in the Wind Tunnel Division as an Instrumentation Technician for the Jacobs ATOM Group at NASA Ames Research Center in Mountain View, California.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Install and maintain instrumentation used in wind tunnel testing including pressure, temperature, force, angle, and motion measurements. Provide technical support on customer developed wind tunnel test articles. Requires ability to perform electronic assembly and installation including soldering, composition<br> of prototype circuits, cables, taper pins, and other instrument connections. Experience with strain gauges, static and dynamic pressure transducers, accelerometers, signal amplifiers, and instrument metrology. Requires the knowledge and skills to understand wiring schematics, control systems and relay logic circuits. This position requires shift work including Day, Swing, and Grave shifts, depending on wind tunnel test requirements.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSITION<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div>\n  <br> \n  <b>Unusual or Special Physical Requirements of Position<\u002Fb>\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Lifting<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Hands on tasks<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Physical Exam Required<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Safety Training<\u002Fli>\n  <\u002Ful>\n <\u002Fdiv> \n <div>\n  <b>Description of Work Environment<\u002Fb>\n  <br> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Office<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Labs<\u002Fli>\n   <li>Model Prep. Candidate must be able to obtain a NASA badge, gain access to the facilities, and obtain a security clearance if requested by the client\u002Fcustomer.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> A minimum of four years of experience in technical instrumentation. Equivalent experience in advanced electronics or other fields pertinent to the position may be substituted. Ability to use test equipment e.g. (oscilloscopes, multimeters). Experience with working in small to medium sized multidiscipline groups will be helpful. Background and experience in aeronautics, instrumentation, data systems and wind tunnel testing is also desirable. <p>Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i> We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. That's why we bring a thoughtful and collaborative approach to every one of our partnerships.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> At Jacobs, we challenge the status quo and redefine how to solve the world's greatest challenges, transforming big ideas into intelligent solutions for a more connected, sustainable world.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <b> Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> The surveyor efficiently organizes and maintains a field survey data to complete project tasks. Accurately calculates and records field data. Reviews project drawings and specifications, plans fieldwork methods. Also, may involve some related duties in the office when needed.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Principal Duties and Responsibilities<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Adhere to established company policies, follow all survey service line procedures and assure that the crew follows standard procedures. Perform field survey activities in accordance with standards set by the state of Idaho, and Jacobs’ project requirements.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assure field crew adheres to procedures in the safety manual and uses all personal safety equipment provided. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Plan daily activities considering possible multiple projects to meet productivity goals set by site management. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>May use of equipment, preparation of sketches and notes, laser scanning collection, GPS and conventional data and other electronic data collection. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>May work without direct day-to-day supervision and make technical and supervisory decisions for projects assigned within specified limits of authority. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Provide input to Construction Project Manager and Construction Manager for the regarding the activities of subcontractor surveying personnel.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Calculates survey data from detailed drawings from sketches, plans, specifications, and written and verbal instructions using computer aided drafting programs.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Verifies subcontractor redline drawing data, performs computations including closure, precision, and calculations for locations of anchor bolts, embedded items, and other critical components during building construction.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Coordinates activities with subcontractor surveyors to verify subcontractor data is complete and accurate, performs field quality assurance of subcontractor survey activities.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Verifies field data and coordinates design elements into record drawings.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Collects survey data and generates redline drawings at the direction of the Construction Project Manager and\u002For Construction Quality Assurance Manager.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Other duties as assigned by the Construction Project Manager and\u002For the Construction Quality Assurance Manager.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Minimum of a high school diploma or equivalent is required.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Registered Professional Surveyor preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Bachelors in a surveying or engineering preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of construction layout and verification of redline drawing data.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>5-years’ experience surveying.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge and experience in GPS surveying, LIDAR Equipment, and conventional survey methods.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>3D scanning experience desirable.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Geology degree or geologist experience preferred<\u002Fli> \n  <li>US Citizenship required<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>PHYSICAL DEMANDS:<\u002Fp> \n <p>The physical demands described herein are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job, dealing effectively and reasonably with stress in the workplace without lost time or undue strain. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit, walk and talk or hear. <p>Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i> We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. That's why we bring a thoughtful and collaborative approach to every one of our partnerships.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> At Jacobs, we challenge the status quo and redefine how to solve the world's greatest challenges, transforming big ideas into intelligent solutions for a more connected, sustainable world.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <b> Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> Mission Statement<\u002Fb><br> Jacobs provides field, range, testing, chemical, and biological laboratory support to the U.S. Army at the West Desert Test Center (WDTC) located at Dugway Proving Ground (DPG), UT. As a major test site for the U.S. Army Test and Evaluation Command, the WDTC is responsible for the test and evaluation of chemical and biological (CB) defense systems, incendiary and smoke\u002Fobscuration munitions systems, and related operational concepts.<br> In addition to these responsibilities, we also support non-CB testing at the WDTC for the DOD and other Federal agencies, including environmental assessment\u002Fimpact evaluation and munitions demilitarization.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Our Dugway Operation was established in 2004 with the award of the Field, Range, Chamber, and Laboratory Support Services (FRC&amp;LSS) contract to Jacobs. Through the FRC&amp;LSS contract, we have integrated with Mellor Engineering, TOPE, and JRAD with a composite staff size of more than 170 personnel.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><br> MELLOR is looking for a candidate with experience and able to perform various types of tasks. The successful candidate will be responsible for the following: Develops tests, plans, cost estimates, and detailed technical approaches. Designs and develops schedules, methods, devices, and equipment, as required, to provide test data and achieve operation’s objectives. Familiar in coordinating plans, statement of work, operating budgets, development of work breakdown structures, and implementing earned value management practices. Acts as primary customer contact for program activity.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The successful candidate will be responsible for the following: Oversee all operations within the Field Division to include testing and training initiatives within the field division. Operational evaluation of equipment and techniques. The ability to innovate and adapt to changing program requirements, and demonstrate problem-solving skills. Develops tests, plans, cost estimates, and detailed technical approaches. Designs and develops schedules, methods, devices, and equipment, as required, to provide test data and achieve operation’s objectives. Familiar in coordinating plans, statement of work, operating budgets, development of work breakdown structures, and implementing earned value management practices. Acts as primary customer contact for program activity.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Required Education and Experience:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Four (4) years of experience in areas of developmental, operational testing or training.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Must be able to prepare operating plans from Government CWO requirements and direct efforts of subordinates in the performance of field and chamber testing.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Familiar in coordinating plans, statements of work, operating budgets, development of work breakdown structures, and implementing earned value management practices.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Acts as primary customer contact for program activity.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Required Clearance: Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret Security Clearance.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p>Essential Functions for Position<\u002Fp> \n     <p>(Must Add Job Specifics)<\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p>Physical Requirements<\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <ul>\n      <li>Medium- Exerts up to 50 lbs. of force occasionally, up to 20 lbs. of force frequently, or up to 10 lbs. of force constantly to move objects. Work may involve sitting or standing for extended periods of time.<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p>Work Environment<\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p>Generally an outdoor environment, but can involve inside or outside work depending on task.<br> An inside environment may be a cubicle (considerations: close quarters, low to moderate noise, bright or dim lighting).<br> Outside work may include various environmental conditions including hot and cold climates.<br> Needs to be able to work well with co-workers and all levels of management.<br> No hazards on job or unusual environmental conditions.<br> Office is located on site in Government spaces at: Dugway Proving Ground, UT.<\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <p>Equipment and Machines<\u002Fp>\n     <br> \n We provide our clients award-winning planning, engineering, architectural and interior design, construction and program management, and design-build project delivery. The Jacobs business model allows us to successfully service our clients, leverage our integrated services, and provide our employees with growth opportunities while delivering global solutions to our client’s local programs. We consistently receive high rankings from Engineering News-Record (ENR) in many classifications, including the categories of Top Design Firms, Top Contractors, Top Green Buildings Design Firms, and Top Transportation Companies.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Position Summary<\u002Fp> \n <p>The Safety Professional develops plans, organizes, coordinates and monitors safety programs to ensure compliance with occupational safety and health regulations, company and client policies and procedures. <\u002Fp>\n <p>This is a site-based role based about 55 miles from Idaho Falls, ID at the Naval Reactors Facility on the Idaho National Lab. This position requires 95% outdoors and 5% office\u002Fadministrative duties. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Typical duties include: <\u002Fp>\n <p>Investigates accidents to determine causes; prepares reports of investigations for use in recommendation of preventive measures and the development of safety programs <\u002Fp>\n <p>Inspects worksites; prepares reports with recommendations for corrective actions <\u002Fp>\n <p>Uses industrial hygiene monitoring equipment to test working areas for noise, toxic and other chemical and physical hazards <\u002Fp>\n <p>Observes craft work to ensure compliance with policies and procedures<\u002Fp> \n <p>Provides\u002Fdevelops technical safety training<\u002Fp> \n <p>Conducts safety management training for supervisory and management personnel <\u002Fp>\n <p>Assesses safety and health program performance; identifies trends through data analysis.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Minimum 5 years of experience in industrial safety required. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>High School diploma or equivalent required. Degree in Health and Safety management preferred <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Related working experience on large job sites related to project \u002F building construction highly preferred.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Good written and verbal communication skills required<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience functioning as safety professional in industrial construction environment essential<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Professional health and safety certification preferred <\u002Fli>\n  <li>First Aid, CPR or OSHA training preferred. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Essential Functions: Intermittent sitting, walking, standing, bending, squatting, climbing, kneeling, twisting, and lifting. Lifting requirements limited to 50 lbs. in the form of supplies, drawings, etc. Longest distance carried of 100 feet. Hand manipulation is required for simple grasping, pushing and pulling, and fine manipulation. Right and\u002For left hands utilized. Occasional need to reach and\u002For work above the shoulder, for supplies, as well as below the shoulder for same. No foot controls necessary. Must be alert to equipment in the field, there will be occasional travel, will work near construction job site equipment when in the field, occasional need to work near hazardous equipment and machinery, continuous need to walk on uneven ground thus good balance and the ability to traverse construction site environment a must, potential exposure to dust, gas or fumes, noise, extremes in temperature (heat and cold) or humidity, and potential work at heights.<\u002Fp> \n <p>At Jacobs, we help prepare people for new opportunities and challenges. With positions at every level, openings in multiple disciplines, expertise in a range of markets and offices around the globe, we create an environment where you can learn, grow, and thrive. <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we challenge the accepted so we can shape innovative and lasting solutions for tomorrow. Through the delivery of our operations and maintenance services, you’ll make it simpler and more seamless for our client to have a safe, reliable and efficient system. You will help us empower communities to focus on what matters most – people.<br> <br> Swift action is needed by committed individuals looking for a long-term employment opportunity to help us address multiple needs and restore a reliable drinking water supply to the city of Jackson, MS. Jacobs is proud to be actively engaged in supporting the successful operation and maintenance of the water facilities and build confidence in the system’s ability to supply safe drinking water for the local community.<br> <br> Jacobs is committed to providing infrastructure solutions that are sustainable, inclusive and equitable. Diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) considerations are central to how we operate as a business and how we serve our clients.<\u002Fp> \n <p>As an Instrumentation and Control CMMS Technician you’ll join a collaborative team and perform the inspection, maintenance and repair for all equipment control circuits including electrical, electronic and pneumatic systems, telemetry systems, signal devices, flow meters, ultrasonic level transmitters, and other equipment found in a water treatment facility. You’ll also interpret and work from blueprints, drawings, sketches, plans and technical documents; perform the calibration and repair of all flow metering devices; perform work with Programmable Logic Controllers, networking, and graphical user interfaces with equipment that communicates with SCADA system; recommend control system modifications with documented justification that will result in standard utilization of parts and materials and will reduce operating and repair costs; establish and maintain scheduled control system maintenance and calibration programs for plant equipment; direct the work of subcontractors and all outside control system repair work; maintain record keeping associated with all SCADA \u002F I&amp;C repairs and modifications and perform other duties as required. Most importantly, you’ll take action to ensure the safety, health and well-being of you and your team.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Bring your team-focus, adaptability, and commitment to excellence, and help Jacobs make an impact in the Jackson, MS community – and deliver value to our client and the communities we serve in Operations Management &amp; Facilities Services (OMFS) projects, together.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>High school diploma or GED and a minimum 2-year experience with working knowledge and understanding of maintenance, repair and calibration of control and electrical systems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with CMMS system’s<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with H&amp;S programs<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Possess a valid driver’s license with no major infractions<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Ideally, You’ll Also Have:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>5 years of experience with the maintenance, repair and calibration of electrical control systems in the water treatment industry<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of the methods, materials, equipment and instruments used in the maintenance, repair and calibration of electrical and electronic control systems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge of the principle and practices of an effective control system preventive maintenance program, safe work practices, and related state and federal laws and regulations<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Ability to develop, implement and train on SOP’s<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with DMS and SCADA systems<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Mechanical and or electrical knowledge and skills related to utilities and\u002For industrial opertitons<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Working Conditions &amp; Physical Requirements:<\u002Fb><br> Safety is a core value at Jacobs. We are committed to providing a safe and healthy workplace for all employees. This position will spend a substantial amount of time performing safety sensitive labor or services. Due to the nature of the job passing a Fitness for Duty testing is required to ensure candidates for this position are physically and functionally fit to perform the essential physical work functions of this safety sensitive position without posing a direct threat to the health or safety of themselves or others.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The physical and environmental demands required to perform the essential duties of this position include standing, walking, sitting, coordination, balance and agility demands, which may include the ability to stoop, kneel, squat, grasp, reach, perform repetitive hand movements. Additional demands may involve a specific level of dexterity, grip strength, climbing and cardiorespiratory demands. The work areas may be indoor, outdoor, have loud noise, active machinery, high pressure fluid systems, electrical equipment, confined spaces, heights and depths, fumes, air borne particles, noxious gases, and chemicals. The use of appropriate safety equipment will be mandatory in these areas to prevent hazardous contact.<\u002Fp> Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), age, medical condition, marital or domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression and transgender status, mental disability or physical disability, genetic information, military or veteran status, citizenship, low-income status or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable law. Learn more about your rights under Federal EEO laws and supplemental language.\n <p><i><br> At Jacobs, we’re challenging today to reinvent tomorrow by solving the world’s most critical problems for thriving cities, resilient environments, mission-critical outcomes, operational advancement, scientific discovery and cutting-edge manufacturing, turning abstract ideas into realities that transform the world for good. With $13 billion in revenue and a talent force of more than 55,000, Jacobs provides a full spectrum of professional services including consulting, technical, scientific and project delivery for the We are looking for a driven and curious client-focused Construction Engineer to grow with our team.<\u002Fp> \n <p>You will assist the project team in providing construction engineering and inspection services on highway, roadway, and bridge projects in the Milwaukee and southeast Wisconsin area. As part of our project team, daily activities may include documenting construction progress and quantities completed, assisting with documentation and record keeping, reviewing contract plans, and specifications, and construction material testing including portland cement concrete. In this role you'll be part of a project team, surrounded by expert mentorship and we’ll support you with what you need to be successful.<\u002Fp> \n <p>We’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. If you’re interested in a rewarding career working with the industry’s best and most innovative engineers, then Jacobs is where you belong.<br> <br> We are looking for a dedicated Land Surveyor Technician to grow with our collaborative team and work on a variety of land development projects. Based at your own home base, we will ask you to travel to sites across the US (up to 50% of the time), and work on a field crew to perform utility surveys in the field using GPS and Robotic Total Station equipment.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>We'll Also Ask you to:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Work primarily in the field on control, boundary, topography, laser scanning and other tasks on a one or two-person crew.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Collect survey data using GNSS receivers, scanners, total stations, levels, and survey controllers.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Produce clear and concise field notes and quality field data for office processing.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Plan daily activities to meet productivity goals. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Communicate with supervisor and office staff about all aspects of the project.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepare daily time sheets, data logs, expense reports and field change orders. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Work outdoors in variable weather conditions and challenging terrain.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform some office duties, including data download and reduction, field note reduction, calculations, processing and quality control checks.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Collaborate with a multi-discipline team and communicate with clients, subconsultants, site supervisors and contractors.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Adheres to company policies and service line procedures.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Follow safety protocols.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform equipment inventory and adjustments and keep current with vehicle maintenance.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participate in department and field crew management.<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our <p>Challenging Today. The candidate will:<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Perform daily checks of the enterprise storage environment.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Assist engineering efforts that provide engineering and technical direction for problem definition, analysis, requirement development.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Participate in efforts that develop recommendations and advice on system development, improvements, optimization, or support efforts.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Be responsible for the implementation of complex systems in the engineering discipline required to meet technical requirements.<\u002Fli> \n automating as much as feasible.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform daily reviews of systems ensure normal maintenance functions are performing properly.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Execute of daily\u002Fweekly system health checks.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform system audit log reviews as required.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Support new projects through the project lifecycle (e.g., requirements 10%, design 10%, implementation 10%, O&amp;M 70%).<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Be required to coordinate efforts with other work centers and personnel to resolve Remedy Incidents related to systems and supporting infrastructure.<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Have other Storage System Engineering\u002FAdministration duties as required.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Will work an 8 hour daily shift between the hours of 0700 and 1700.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b>There will also be some shift and on-call work required to assist with after-hours maintenance activities.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><i>Our People &amp; Places Solutions business – reinforces our drive to improve the lives of people everywhere and epitomizes the \"why\" of what we do – the tremendous positive impact and value our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. From facilities delivering life-saving therapies and ensuring clean water to enabling the connection of people through all modes of transportation and providing access to technology – we're integrating a multitude of these solution elements to build the smart environments of tomorrow.<\u002Fi><br> <br> <i>Start your Jacobs career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <br> \n <b>Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> At Jacobs, we’re partnering across the globe to create the best project outcomes by maximizing the design, digital technology, and support capabilities of our Global Integrated Delivery (GID) teammates. By joining Jacobs, you’ll commit to supporting and engaging with these teams, as we work to build a company like no other.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>At Jacobs, we value and respect our employees and their energy, diversity and knowledge that they bring to each project they work on. We’re currently looking for a driven Junior Geologist to join our growing team in New York. The opportunities are endless as you grow your career while working in both the field and office. Office tasks may include data interpretation, quantitative modeling using numerical methods, data visualization, report writing, aiding in the preparation of presentations, and the coordination of logistics for field efforts. Fieldwork tasks may include conducting environmental site remediation, soil excavation, groundwater treatment, logging soil borings; installing wells\u002Fpiezometers; sampling groundwater, soil, and surface water; aquifer testing and documenting activities on site among other tasks.<\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>In this role, you will have support and mentorship as you work on a variety of challenging projects with different clients. Working on a multi-disciplinary team full of unique backgrounds, you’ll own your career as you develop as a geologist and redefine what’s possible. You’ll get the opportunity to connect with staff from across the Country as you embark on your new journey. We’re invested in you and your success as you can help deliver the boldest solutions for today and the future at Jacobs.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><br> Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Bachelor's Degree in Hydrogeology, Hydrology, Geology or closely related field<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledge and experience with various media (e.g., soil, soil vapor, groundwater, surface water and sediment) investigations, data assessments and evaluations, and remediation technologies<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Experience with Microsoft Office software<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Knowledgeable in field work methodology and procedures typically used in the environmental industry<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p>Additional information:<\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Estimated field to office time split: 75% field\u002F 25% office<\u002Fli> \n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Estimated travel requirement<\u002Fp> Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity\u002FAffirmative Action Employer. <p>Challenging Today. Reinventing Tomorrow.<\u002Fp> \n <p><i> We're invested in you and your success. Everything we do is more than just a project. It's our challenge as human beings, too. That's why we bring a thoughtful and collaborative approach to every one of our partnerships.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> At Jacobs, we challenge the status quo and redefine how to solve the world's greatest challenges, transforming big ideas into intelligent solutions for a more connected, sustainable world.<\u002Fi><\u002Fp> \n <p><i> Design your career with a company that inspires and empowers you to deliver your best work so you can evolve, grow and succeed – today and into tomorrow<\u002Fi><\u002Fp>\n <br> \n <div><\u002Fdiv> \n <b> Your Impact:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> Mechanical Engineering Summer Intern<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Jacobs Technology, Inc., a global engineering services company headquartered in Tullahoma, Tennessee, will offer a <i>Mechanical Engineering<\u002Fi><i> <\u002Fi>internship opportunity. The opportunity will commence in the summer term of 2023 and will be awarded to an outstanding student who is majoring in mechanical engineering.<\u002Fp> \n <p>The student selected as the Jacobs Technology Scholar will work at Jacobs’ <i>Tullahoma, Tennessee<\u002Fi> office. The student will work under the supervision of a technical manager and mentor in the Process Mechanical and\u002For Machine Design group – groups that perform engineering design of complex testing equipment and facilities for the automotive and aerospace industries.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Intern students will work 40-hour work weeks for approximately 10 weeks during the months of June, July, and August (negotiable). Students will work on project teams under the direction of a manager and with the assistance of a mentor, are required to attend planned activities, and must make an end-of-assignment presentation to other co-ops and Jacobs’ staff.<\u002Fp> \n <p>It is the responsibility of the selected candidate to make their own housing arrangements for the duration of the internship period. Jacobs can provide suggestions for housing options in the local area.<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Job Duties:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <ul>\n  <li>Perform a variety of routine engineering tasks under the direction of experienced engineers to provide experience and familiarization with engineering methods, practices, and programs<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Perform limited portions of larger more complex engineering tasks under the direction of an experienced engineer<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Prepare computations, specifications, and reports of limited scope and complexity<\u002Fli> \n  <li>Design and analyze mechanical systems to meet project specific and code requirements<\u002Fli> \n  <li>May coordinate the work of drafters in the development of 3D models and 2D drawing packages<\u002Fli> \n  <li>May review subcontractor submittals and shop drawings and provide limited support during construction at project sites <\u002Fli>\n  <li>May coordinate and interface with clients and other disciplines – including design, presentations, design reviews, and training at the Jacobs office, client office, or project site<\u002Fli> \n  <li>May assist with project planning, budgeting, and cost estimating<\u002Fli> \n  <li>A combination of mechanical process and machine design is anticipated<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <br> \n <p><\u002Fp>\n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <p><b><br> Eligibility:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>We are looking for a creative individual with a basic understanding of mechanical and process analysis and design. To be considered for a Jacobs Technology internship position, students must meet the following criteria:<\u002Fp> \n <p><b>Required Qualifications:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n <p>Degree Program: BSME or MSME our solutions bring to our communities and society as a whole. You’ll contribute to our growth and client focused initiatives that have a significant impact upon on business. We’ll ask you to leverage your expertise to mentor and develop our team to help us build our skills, knowledge and resources to enable us to win transformative projects and deliver long term value.<\u002Fp> \n <p>Working together, we’ll help you grow and pursue what fulfills you so that we can make impacts on the future – big and small, global and local.<\u002Fp> \n <b>Here’s What You’ll Need:<\u002Fb>\n <br> \n <ul> \n  <li>Progressive experience in resilience planning.
